Reviews.Title: “Very unique look for a chain.”
Reviews.Author: Neil V
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the decor and style of this hotel. Parking is a little on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing is the location...”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Hotel Indigo in Chicago, IL. We stayed there for 2 nights, a Saturday and Sunday. The only good thing I can really say about this hotel is the location. It was only about a 10 minute walk from Michigan Ave. and had every type of restaurant/store nearby that you could want. When we first walked in the decor was great and the lobby looked extremely nice. The staff when we checked in was not too friendly or overly nice but everyone is entitled to having a bad day. We then were told that we had a smoking room, which we were unaware of. When we stepped off of the elevator the entire floor wreaked of smoke. I have stayed in other hotels on the smoking floor and have never had this problem. When we walked into the room we noticed the decor was very cute and colorful but the size was extremely small. Not only was the room extremely small but there was a spider on the wall which had been killed and smeared across the ceiling..quite disgusting. The TV looked to be about a 19" from the late 1990's and was somewhat hard to see from the bed because it was so small. The bathroom was fine and was the most modern thing in the room, although the sink did back up when I brushed my teeth but eventually went down after a few minutes. The room was equipped with a keurig, however we were given only decaf coffee. I'm sure we could have called down and asked for regular but did not feel like going through all that and went to starbucks instead. The worst part of my stay was the fact that the walls of this hotel are EXTREMELY thin. For approximately 30 mins we could here people in a room down the hall have sexual relations. It was absolutely disgusting and for this reason and all of the others, I will NEVER stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed.”
Reviews.Author: codyadalyn
Reviews.Content: I'm currently sitting in my room in this hotel, with my view of the fire escape and my 1992 era television. Upon arrival around midnight last night, I was told there was only a public parking deck next door but if I wanted street parking, I could come down and start feeding a meter at 8am. It would seem I was lucky there was a $39/day deck next door. I then attempted to enter my room with what would appear to be 2 bad keys. After returning to the front desk (I was treated very nicely by the night manager) she came up with me and it turns out the key has to sit in the slot for 10 seconds before you can get in. Wow. The room is ok. The laminate hardwood floors would be a decent touch, if they werent uneven and chipped in parts. I can also hear everything my neighbors are doing. When I called to order some coffee and breakfast, the chick in the restaurant said she would call me back and when I picked up the phone when she did, she just said "yeah?" as if I had interrupted her mid-conversation. When I asked how long I could wait for breakfast she complained about how she was the only one there, and there were other people waiting, and it would be 20 minutes for my yogurt, fruit, and coffee. I'm not impressed with the service, the room, or anything else I've seen. I've stayed at an Indigo in Asheville and LOVED it so I was excited to try this one in Chicago. My excitement was quickly dispelled with and now I'm wishing I'd shelled out the extra money for the Dana or Wyndham where I normally stay.

Reviews.Title: “Week of Feb 27th”
Reviews.Author: MrLund
Reviews.Content: My associate and I stayed at this hotel in town for a week long training. The staff were very helpful and got to know us in a personal way. They went above and beyond. Veronika at the front desk was amazing! You all made the week fun.

Reviews.Title: “Monique H. put the ! on a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandClaire
Reviews.Content: First met Monique while getting coffee and pastry in the area near the restaurant on the morning we departed. She was very friendly, engaging and not just going through the motions (believe she was in some sort of customer service capacity with the hotel). Her actions and attitude were in contrast to a previously posted comment that "the staff were polite at best, rather than friendly" (I might agree with this comment relative to the front desk personnel the night we checked in, however). Monique is an asset to the hotel. Overall, our stay was good, no issue with either of the 2 rooms we had. Liked the location and the decor (bright, cheerful, trendy). Will consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: RebaS83
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through Priceline's name your own price so I didn't know what hotel I was staying at until I paid. I have stayed at Hotel Indigo in Vernon Hills before and remember how nice and inviting it was. I called the night before since check in wasnt until 4, but I had luggage with me and had afternoon plans before and wanted to make sure i could drop my stuff off early and the guy on the phone said yes. So it was nice I was able to drop my things off and not worry about it. The girl at the desk wasn't necessarily rude but she wasn't friendly. When I did come back to check in, i asked if I could have a later check out and the rep said I could, but I had to sign up for the rewards program. Which I did since it was free, but I found that a little annoying, just a simple request for a late check required me to be a rewards member. When I arrived to my room, it was smaller than I expected but it wasn't cramped. It was very inviting, bright and clean. About 10 minutes after I was in, the front desk called to make sure everything was okay. A few things i noticed, once of the bed side lamps didn't work...not a big deal, I used the other one. The lamp on the side table wasn't even plugged in which was weird. The maginfying makeup mirror didn't light up as well, but it was nice they had that to do eyemakeup. I loved that the bathroom had a nice shelf all along the mirror to make up for no vanity. The shower was nice however, the pressure could have better and the shampoo and conditioner weren't the best either. I used the hair dryer in the room...but it was blowing out cold air! I called the front desk and within 5 minutes someone brought me a new one that worked much better! The bed was extremely comfortable...I slept like a baby. I just wish the curtains were better at covering the window, I had too much sun coming in this morning that woke me up early than I wanted. Also, the tv is set up kinda high, so you have to raise the remote up at an awkward level to change the channels. I did take a look at the menu in the room for the restaurant downstairs and the prices seemed reasonable. However I did not order food, so I can't write about the quality. In the morning, it seems like the doors slam behind guests so that was also annoying as I'm trying to sleep in the morning with the doors being shut. Overall, I would come back and recommend it to others. It is a great location...only a block away from the red line (clark and division), less than a $10 cab ride to union station.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed blessing”
Reviews.Author: StevieBatesy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Indigo for four nights while attending a conference at the Newberry Library, for which it is conveniently placed - a five-minute stroll down Dearborn. The staff were polite at best, rather than friendly, and not very helpful. The room (311) was fairly large, no view, pleasantly decorated and clean. However, I could not get served at the restaurant (there never appeared to be any staff serving, or guests eating) and struggled to get room service. The heater was also very noisy and I ended up turning it off to sleep. The most significant incident, however, occurred on my final morning when I was woken by someone posting a bill under the door. I had made a 5-minute phonecall home to the UK having checked the cost in the literature in the room: this only said that overseas calls would be charged at an international rate. I figured a premium call would be about $1 a minute, but the bill was $26. It made me feel a bit of a fool, but that doesn't change the fact that it's a ridiculously expensive rate. In summary then: conveniently located to the golden mile and clean, but unhelpful staff (and don't make international calls if you stay here!) I myself won't be returning to the Indigo when next at the Newberry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn620
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. My daughter and I stayed to see a museum with friends and do some Christmas shopping. It was the perfect location. There was a mix up with parking, however. The hotel told me one price, and then when I went to get my car, I was told another price by the attendant so I had to go back and get the price adjusted and repay for parking at the hotel. Not sure why, but I couldn't just pay for parking at the parking garage. A very unnecessary hassle to an otherwise very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant is fantastic!! Fred is Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: opinionss
Reviews.Content: We live in the neighborhood and stopped in for dinner one night. What a wonderful place to eat. Fred who is waiter and chef was great. The food was delicious and it was prepared beautifully. He was so friendly and you could tell he really enjoyed what he did and took pride in his preperation of the food. We knew his goal was to be sure we enjoyed our dinner and experience in the restaurant. The atmosphere was so relaxing. We would highly recommend this restaurant in the back of the Indigo Hotel. If you have an employee recognition program we recommend Fred be highly commended for the work he does and the pleasant experience he ensures his custmers have!!!

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating Our 15th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: SohailMomin
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 15th Anniversary in Chicago. I chose this Hotel because I wanted something that is close to downtown but without the hustle and bustle of downtown. Hotel is quite homely. It provides modern day luxuries in a more familial style. At check-in staff was extremely pleasent even to the point that I joked that "How come a person with Hilton in his name is working for Intercontinental Hotel Group (IHG)". Tom Hilton, who received us at the front desk, had quite a laugh at it. After arriving at the room, I received a phone call from Tom to ensure that everything was ok and we could let the front desk know, if we desire anything". On the day of our anniversary, we received a token of appreciation in the form of local chocolates from Housekeeper. I think his name was Greg. Overall, this trip was wonderful. Staff greeting us as we are getting off and taking the elevators. Although we had train passes, we decided to take a Taxi to the station from the Hotel. Bell man fetched a Taxi for us while it was drizzling outside. This whole trip had been amazing and Hotel staff ensured that we had a great time while there. Sohail and Mehjabeen Momin

Reviews.Title: “I enjoy my trip and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prince407
Reviews.Content: really nice and comfortable hotel~I love all the colors and decoration. The server there is really nice, especially the front desk, Tom Hilton, he is really patient, considerate, hard-working and sweet,:-) I enjoy all the experience in the hotel, the Christmas chocolate and nice photos with Tom!

Reviews.Title: “Small, personal, stylish and clean hotel in great area.”
Reviews.Author: marklpe
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I wanted to stay close to downtown but at a more intimate setting the the giant corporate hotels. The hotel is small (in a good way) personal, and very clean. We pulled right up to the front door and the desk was only steps away. The parking, elevator, and room were all very close and convenient. The staff was very courteous, helpful and friendly. The rooms are very cool - hardwood floors, bright colors, not your typical hotel room. The hotel is located in a great area within walking distance to great restaurants and shops. Will definetly stay at Indigo again. The only downside would be that the heating unit fans are somewhat noisy (at least in our room) we ended up shutting it off the second night and the lack of storage (which has been mentioned in other reviews). Otherwise I would highly recommend the hotel for couples and those who are looking for a smaller, fun, more intimate hotel in the downtown area

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie_Quinn_Batch
Reviews.Content: They have the best customer service I have ever experienced! I would advise anyone who is coming to Chicago to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, with one exception”
Reviews.Author: jengaworld
Reviews.Content: I was delighted for the opportunity of a return stay at the Hotel Indigo. Despite others' experience with third-party booking, I was actually treated very well. Due to travel delays, I arrived in Chicago near midnight (several hours later than scheduled). I was concerned about the room status since this was a Hotwire booking. But the front desk clerk, Lissa, could not have been more helpful. I phoned ahead and she said, "Yes, I see your Hotwire booking" -- [so she knew this was 3rd party] -- and I have noted your delayed arrival for a reservation of one night." I replied it was actually two nights -- we had added on a second night after the initial reservation. Lissa quickly found this information, and remembered it when I finally arrived very late that night at the hotel. Her greeting was friendly and professional -- as soon as I identified myself, she let me know she was the person to whom I had spoken on the phone, and she expressed empathy for the long day of travel delays. (A small thing, perhaps, but it really makes a difference to a tired traveler.) She also told me just to come down to the desk in the morning and they would work out having the "second" reservation applied to my room without necessitating a move. When I came down the next morning, the only downside was a non-uniformed woman working at the front desk computer. I explained about the reservation consolidation and she *rolled her eyes*(!), made some sort of snorting noise and said "I don't think so," and went back to what she was doing. It was appallingly rude. Luckily a woman standing next to her (who was in the "uniform" of other clerks) quickly said, "Yes, Miss ____, I took care of the reservation this morning and you are all set!" I said the other woman had been very rude; the competent clerk apologized and asked if she could take care of breakfast. I had already eaten, but I appreciated the offer to make things right. Note to management, though: the older woman who works the computer and is not dressed like the clerks should not have contact with guests. Kudos on the excellent night clerk and morning clerk. I typically book directly through the hotel, although in this instance I used Hotwire on a whim -- and I am pleased to say that I have been treated cordially no matter the booking source (as should be the case in a competently managed hotel.) P.S. -- The only oddity: since the elevator is near the front door, I realized many guests do not realize there is a small restaurant in the back of the lobby. Rooms have a large menu for a restaurant nextdoor, but no info on in-house dining, which is too bad because it is in a very cute space!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: NatureLover54
Reviews.Content: The good: We really liked the decor and set up of this hotel -very peaceful-had a room with double queen beds that was bright with many chairs and benches, lots of lights, adequate space, full-length mirrrors, big, fluffy towels and easy-access internet service in the room. Ate across the street at Mario's-great Italian food with half portions available for good cost, then walked down to Michigan Avenue, which was an easy walk with wide sidewalks and well lit. Parking gargage with valet parking was conveniently located beside the hotel and got the car shortly after calling for it. The bad: If you book your room through a third party, they place a $50 hold on your credit card for incidentals, then refund any balance; they will not participate in valet parking, such as calling them for you, as it is a separate business; they will not take responsibility for any offers/services listed for their hotel on the third-party (Expedia, in our case) web site and will not provide any kind of a receipt other than for whatever incidentals you purchase while there. The ugly: Both check-in and check-out hotel staff seemed very resentful that we had booked third-party, rather than directly with them. There were 3 of us in the room, as we noted when we made the reservation. We had opted to upgrade from the room for $139 to the $180 offer, which stated it included a full breakfast. My husband was the first down to breakfast and found there was no such offer of a full breakfast -what was available for the extra money ($41) was a roll, coffee and juice. My husband tried to cancel the breakfast and get a refund, but the staff refused, saying they had to pay Expedia for it and it could not be refunded. When my daughter and I came down, we found they had collected the breakfast coupon from my husband and that the breakfast was only good for 2 guests, not 3 and we needed to negotiate for the coupon that was required to redeem the roll, juice and coffee breakfast that only 1 more of us was allowed to redeem. Some expensive breakfast, huh?? Our dismay was increased as the night before we had ordered a dessert that came with ice cream, but were told they had run out of ice cream and no adjustment was offered in the price. Seems we were offensive to them by booking third party and not entitled to any refunds for any reason -staff said they sell blocks of rooms to the third party bookers and were not responsible for anything they listed, such as the "full breakfast," and claimed the bookers merely lifted things off the hotel web site. Apparently, that was where Expedia got the full breakfast idea -we suggested they contact their third party bookers and give them the correct info to avoid other guests being as deeply disappointed as we were, but got only a weak half-smile in response. It could be such a great place with a totally wonderful experience if not for the second-class citizens third party booking guests!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms with Old TV and uncomfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: LESMEX
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and in top of that they haven put a plasma or HD TV. The bed move because the legs are not very strong. The rooms are not ugly but it will be nice to put a plasma TV.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Indigo”
Reviews.Author: ca8790
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my first Indigo experience in San Antonio, so I was pleased when Hotwire assigned me to this property in Chicago. I stayed here while on tour with a band; we drive a 15 passenger van. I was initially pleased at the 24 hr/in&out privilege parking garage next door, but they weren't able to accommodate my van. This really sucked, as I would later come to fully realize. There was a lot a block over that took my van. Check in was a little slow after Hotwire screwed up my booking and had to call the hotel to fix it. They did, so props to them, but there was some back and forth between management and the front desk girl before they confirmed my double rooms.. The rooms were nice, like somebody gave my mom lots of money to design a hotel. Mine had a beachy vibe, was spacious and clean. There was a nice TV, great view of the city, and great bathroom as well. We were happy to be staying there. The wifi DID NOT work on my computer, had to go use the business center. Nobody at the hotel could fix the problem. Not a huge deal I guess. There were some lame frat guys that tried to start a fight with a member of my party, so the crowd at this place is clearly mixed. This hotel is in a great, super happening area. Zero shortage of things to do. Prime location *Drivers of oversize vehicles beware* - Parking sucks in Chicago. I had to park 7, long blocks away. It took 1.5 hours to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, HORRIBLE PARKING”
Reviews.Author: IowAndrew
Reviews.Content: This location is fantastic. If you want to experience the madness of Chicago but don't want to stay in it, you should stay here. This hotel is tucked away in a posh neighborhood of Chicago but within walking distance of Old Town, State Street, Michigan Avenue and the lake. The rooms are nice although the decor is a bit overwhelming, much like a hotel in South Beach, FL. The rooms are very small with VERY SMALL bathrooms. The customer services is not that great and the hotel doesn't offer much other than a place to stay. Park your car somewhere else!!! The valet for this hotel is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE and you have to use it because they do not allow self parking. You will have to wait at least 30 minutes to get your car.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for the price category.”
Reviews.Author: I_travel_alot_11
Reviews.Content: Average for the price category. Valet parking costs $37 a night at the parking garage next door. Room service provided by the italian restaurant across the street . Room advice--stay away from 202! It's located above the hotels street entrance as well as being right next to the fitness center. Despite the room darkening thicker drapes, you can still hear taxis, tour buses andante service trucks driving by. In the fitness center they placed the treadmill against the common wall. Every morning we were awakened at 7:30am by the droning sound of someone running briskly on the treadmill.

Reviews.Title: “A night out in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DigginWA
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Indigo because we had tickets to Second City and wanted to set out on foot for dinner and the show. As Priority Rewards members, we were upgraded to a bigger room. Fun decor, a bit nicked up here and there but very clean and comfortable with instant desk and bellhop service. Our room looked west over rooftops and was very quiet. There is a small bar and food area in the lobby but we didn't stop moving long enough to find out what they were serving. Parking was in a valet garage next door and ran an extra $39. This location on Dearborn is a bit more residential and was very peaceful yet still easy to walk to Rush, Michigan, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: jmmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Indigo for family Weekend at DePaul. The hotel decor is magical. Huge Alice in Wonderland type chairs in the lobby. The bright painted walls were gorgeous. Starbucks coffee and a nice room service menu. Cute little bar as well. A hidden gem was the restaurant across the street: Mario's. Absolutely divine Italian..lots of garlic! The hotel was not as close to the trains as we would have liked, but all in all a lovely boutique hotel, and spotless clean!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !!!”
Reviews.Author: Jubee_16
Reviews.Content: We came from Gatineau and stayed for 4 days at the Indigo in beginning of October. It was very nice. Thanks to Tom and the lovely staff over there. We had a wonderful time !

Reviews.Title: “Terrific comfort, location & service - I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: TooEnergetic
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo has become my favorite hotel in Chicago. It genuinely feels like a home when I'm away from home. The staff is tremendously warm, courteous and attentive. The location is absolutely perfect...within walking distance of dining, shopping, entertainment, transit and the shore. The street is quaint and peaceful but the surrounding neighborhood is alive and vibrant. During spring/summer, there's event a Saturday farmer's market on Division (the closest cross street). The rooms are comfortably sized and the beds feel great! The atmosphere is so welcoming that I often find myself chatting with other guests at the bar or the lobby lounge area. I haven't taken advantage of the salon and massage services in the on-site spa. But I enjoy knowing that they're there if I need them. If I have my way, I'll stay here every time I'm in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Breath of fresh air in the big city”
Reviews.Author: LynnAckerman
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying at this hotel after reading some negative reviews. I don't get it. This place was so cute, and customer service was great. I asked for a no smoking room and got one, and had no sense that they tried to cover up the smell of smoke with air freshener. The lobby and rooms were bright, cheery, and chic. The theme of the hotel is balance in nature, so all the colors and concepts reflect this idea. There is a classy little lounge called Phi next to the front desk and a small cafe called The Golden Bean that serves Starbucks coffee and has plenty of cozy seating. Our room was small but quaint and nicely decorated. It was definitely big enough for a romantic couple. The bed was very comfortable. The room had Aveda products in the bathroom and a Keurig coffe maker. The whole place was a breath of fresh air, but not where you should go if you are looking for glamour. It felt kind of Bed and Breakfast with a touch of class. The hotel is located on Dearborn Parkway, which is lined with trees, quiet, and residential despite being just a few blocks away from the Rush and Division bar scene. The only negative thing that happened was some noise from drunk people trying to get to their rooms while we were trying to sleep. But what do you expect when you are two blocks from a strip of bars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingT-Rex
Reviews.Content: I like it! From a strict starring perspective, the hotel is probably a 3.5. This is an old building that has been "funkified" with an urban interpretation of East Coast seaside-cottage decor. Just like a coastal cottage it is slightly worn, but fun, fresh, and casually quirky. Nice, not luxurious. My room was small, but charming. The bed was extremely comfortable...which made for a great nights sleep. The location is what seals the deal!! The hotel is in the middle of a quiet, classy, tree-lined residential brownstone neighborhood. It is about a block away from several restaurants, coffee shops, and drug stores. The lake shore (beach park) is four blocks away (an easy five minute walk). There are also several health clubs within walking distance. All the benefits of downtown, with the serenity of the burbs...thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Barb V
Reviews.Content: We recently had my daughter's bachelorette party at Hotel Indigo. It was perfect! The suite was spacious and the accommodations made by the staff were top rate. They provided us with a wet bar, carried all of the party supplies up without having to be told and worked with us to provide extras! The room itself was fabulous with a "Nantucket" sort of feel. It certainly provided the festive environment that we hoped for. The staff was more than helpful and made this a very memorable evening. In addition the hotel's location can't be beat--it is only 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue shopping and Rush Street restaurants. I will most certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great staff----you rock Tom”
Reviews.Author: kenBarrington_Canada
Reviews.Content: This is long overdue but I would stay here again for 1 reason and one reason only and his name is Tom Hilton( we think thats his last name).I tried to send email directly to his manager but cant seem to be able to do that.Tom if you see this I am the non-smoker in the smoking room---I put money on that you remember me .Next timewe come to see the cubs,you get my buisness,matter of fact anytime I am lucky enough to visit Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: DMBJAX
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the hotel indigo for the past 3 years and have never been disappointed. Very helpful staff. Only negative is the daily cost to park a car in the garage next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are small and have an old TV.”
Reviews.Author: LESMEX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and very clean and staff is very polite, what I didn't like is that if the room is small it should have a nice HD TV: Plasma or LCD. But the TV was very small. The rooms to be hones are NOT very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in killer location”
Reviews.Author: Rosewilltravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights after getting the hotel on Priceline. I like it. Reminds me of a European Hotel. Lobby is spacious, staff is incredibley helpful and friendly. My room had a king size bed with plenty of room to move around in. Bed was comfortable, shower worked great and I love the hardwood floors. I would stay again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Neighborhood, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonopahAz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in August 2011 for business. The hotel seems really nice at first glance and it is a bit unusual in color scheme. The two rooms I stayed in were similar, but the floor plan was different. The good: Good location and a nice neighborhood where you feel safe. Easy walking distance to hotels, drug stores, grocery stores, etc. If you eat or order coffee from their restaurant and have a RapidRewards account, be sure to tell them to get a discount. Fitness center had a good variety and was clean, but it closes at 10 p.m. The not so good: Small bathroom, struggled to find a place to put my personal grooming items. Weird shower (no tub) and water ended up on bathroom floor due to design. In room safe did not work in either room I was in. Housekeeping was spotty. Bell Staff of a morning would be talking to other hotel staff and then when they say I was hailing a taxi , would come out and try to help me for a tip.

Reviews.Title: “GIANT KILLER BLUEBERRIES IN A TINY ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: nrpacino
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Indigo because it was closest to my son's off-campus apartment. The hotel itself is a re-purposed older building. DO NOT expect a typical roomy ichoice hotel. The lobby is open and fresh with a funky modern flair, but the hallways are dark and very narrow with older dingy carpets and moldings that look as if theyâ€™ve been painted over way too many times. The elevators are slow, tiny and smell slightly mildewy. On first glance, my room seemed more on par with the lobby- hardwood floors, white â€œcoastalâ€� furniture, and crisp bedding, but upon further inspection, it was very small and oddly-shaped with a very low ceiling. There were few lights in the entire room, and the bathroom (no tub) was so tiny, you had to straddle the toilet in order to close the door! (Also, there was no bathroom exhaust fan, so the entire room felt humid after a shower.) Did I mention the blueberry wallpaper? We're not talking a quaint petite print. We're talking strange GIANT 3-FOOT BLUEBERRIES across the entire bedroom wall. I felt like I was sleeping in the produce section of my local grocery! (Was this a miserable attempt to give the room a more spacious feel?) I'm usually not one to complain, so long as the room is clean and maintained, but the entire environment was just plain ODD. Couple this with the startling noises coming from the hallway (and the street) at all hours of the night; my entire stay was less than relaxing- an absolute disappointment for $200 per night. It seems as if they intended to transform this downtown building into a â€œretreatâ€�, but ran out of money when it came to the common areas above the ground floor, and decided that since real estate and hotels are at a premium in downtown Chicago why not add a few extra rooms on each floor? Bottom line: If youâ€™re above average height or breadth, you will definitely feel uncomfortable. Iâ€™m neither, and still felt cramped- sort of like how it feels to fly coach on an overbooked flight. You get the picture. The front desk staff WAS polite. All 10 words he spoke to me were cordialâ€¦. The location IS perfect for anyone planning to shop the Gold Coast. Although I doubt you could fit more than two girlfriends and a few shopping bags into a single room. Also, please take note that the parking garage is located in the next building, and is an ADDITIONAL $30 (typical of downtown Chicago). If you dare park your car, you will be required to wait just inches from the sidewalk (and the elements) at the entrance to the narrow, tiny, dirty garage. The valet (if available) sits behind a grimy, bullet-proof glass window, and will not (did not) help load luggage, as he was more concerned with quickly getting my car out of the way for an incoming vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “So-So hotel - super neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: physics911
Reviews.Content: The title of this post pretty much says it all. The hotel is mediocre at best; not super, not horrible, just so-so. One big negative, the hallway of the floor I was staying on reeked of smoke, and I mean reeked. However, the location is amidst some of the most beautiful housing you will find in the Chicagoland area, and just a block south are numerous bars, restaurants, clubs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Small hiden gem in big city!”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierfan_7
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Indigo hotels before, but never this particular one. The price was right and it was in a location that was near where we wanted to be. Parking is not good, so it's best to use a taxi to arrive. The furnishings in the room were a complete surprise for Chicago...the room had hardwood floors with furniture and colors reminiscent of beach rentals where we have stayed. Very bright colors and nicely decorated accents in the room. There was complimentary coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby not only in the morning, but that night when we arrived. A nice litle "extra" when coming in from the cold Chicago weather. The area has a few bars and restaurants within half a block or two from the hotel...not large places, but smaller with a neighborhood feel. Chicago is a great city to visit and this botique type hotel located in the Gold Coast area is within easy access to the "el" and taxi traffic if you don't want to walk. We will probably stay here again if we need to be in this area of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gold Coast Option”
Reviews.Author: KevinTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Indigo for a weekend after a conference in Chicago. I've stayed at several Indigos and this one is similar to the rest. The decor is bright and supposed to be modeled after a beach house. The exterior of the property is nice. The area is very nice, primarily upscale residential. The building appears to be pretty historical. The folks running the front desk were very friendly and upgraded my room to a larger King room. The room was fairly large with a small dining area in addition to the bed area and a larger bathroom. The TV was a flat panel and the internet (free) was fairly fast. Overall, the property is a nice option in the area. It's not exactly "luxurious" but it is quaint if you like beach-house setting. The rooms are clean and the location is great. It is a bit of a walk from transit if you have bags, you may want to take a taxi if you don't want to do the few blocks. The rooms are priced about what rooms in Chicago in the summer are priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - fun to try something different in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: hotelveteran
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of a bid on Priceline. I was initially disappointed by the selection - never heard of it and it seemed far from downtown on the map. We were so happy when we pulled up,it was located in such a beautiful neighborhood of brownstones. It was a little bit of a walk to Michigan Ave., but it was such a pretty walk it didn't matter. There were so many places to eat and coffee shops steps away that we stayed in the neighborhood each night for dinner. (loved Q) The kids also loved the little park in the middle of the Rush Street area that had a darling gelato shop in it. It felt like a European little square. The hotel was very colorful - lots of navy and white. Most people were very friendly. There were a few that I thought should have offered us a greeting when we came back to the hotel instead of just looking at us, but others were great. It was terribly hot while we were there and they did put a large glass container of lemon water on the bar that was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: sarabhons
Reviews.Content: The rooms were definitely clean and the service was good. However, I didn't feel this hotel was a real value for the money spent. The rooms were incredibly small and difficult to share with a second person; a double room is about the size of a small bedroom. The bathroom was small as well. There was no fridge in the room which I found odd. The decor and ambiance of the hotel is pleasant and relaxing. If I paid around $60-$70 per night I would be pleased. However, I paid much more.

Reviews.Title: “Fun decor, nice room, great location, worn at the edges”
Reviews.Author: katdarcy
Reviews.Content: This is a good value for the area. Room was very cute with a beachy blue, green and white decor. The place showed a bit of wear -- toilet flush not strong enough, broken shower control, bit of musty smell, air conditioner not very responsive, but everything else okay and the problems listed weren't drastic, just evidence of wear and tear. The bar closes too early, also. Otherwise this is a pretty good place to stay and I loved the fact that I could walk to great restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: mooreinsobe
Reviews.Content: WOW! The hotel staff was fantastic. The room was spacious for Chicago. I felt like I was part of the neighborhood. Be sure to visit the lobby bar for a well made Cosmo or other favorite libation. Excellent value! I left thinking I was not charged enough for my room! This hotel is an undiscovered Jewel. If you want to be treated like a valued guest, this is the place to stay! By the way, did I say "Excellent service staff"? I will definately be back as I visit Chicago several times per year!

Reviews.Title: “Still The Best”
Reviews.Author: MarkinAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Indigo frequently due to business since it opened several years ago. This past weekend, I took a weekend trip to Chicago for the 1st time in 2 years and was pleasantly suprised to see the same staff at the front desk, they even remembered my name as I approached the counter. As I looked around, I reconized the bartender and the door man too, it was as if time stood still for 2 years since the last time I was there. The hotel looked as good as it did since it opened and the renovation to the fitness room has a great new look . There are lots of hotel's with great deals in Chicago these days, but the friendly staff and the attention to detail is what keeps me coming back to the Indigo. The Indigo is "Still the Best" and I look forward going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bad mildew/mold from air conditioning (beware if allergies!)”
Reviews.Author: PewaukeeWI
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, nice neighborhood -- close enough to walk to & along Lake Michigan. Easy to get to restaurants. Great breakfast at the hotel in the a.m. However, the room we had smelled awful due to the mold/mildew smell coming from the air conditioning vent. We were only there 1 night & reported it to the desk staff in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most family or Hotwire friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bronclone
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Indigo from 7/12-7/14. We got a fairly good deal through Hotwire, but realized that the deal was not as good upon check-in. Be aware that they will charge $30/night extra for a room with 2 double beds. Parking is $36 per night, but this is to be expected as the location is in the city. Another note- if you have young children and they like to take baths, that is not possible here as there is only a shower in the bathroom. Beds were comfortable and the Aveda products in the room was a nice touch. Location was good, with easy access to the subway station, Michigan Ave, etc. Overall, i would probably not recommend this hotel if you have small children. Might be nice if you are looking to explore the nightlife and vast amount of shopping that the area has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Caring Staff (thanks, Tom!), Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FairmindedTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here during Memorial Day weekend, and I'm glad I did. Booked this through a travel site and was excited that it was the Indigo, as co-workers (in Denver) have stayed here before and raved about it. Even my stupidity could be overcome -- I pride myself on being a "good guest," not showing up hours before check-in and being knowledgeable about the hotel area. So silly me, even after seeing us outfly horrible storms into Chicago, decided to kill time in downtown (shopping, parade etc) and then head up to Gold Coast (grocery shopping for in-room drinks-snacks, fruit etc). By the time I finished, it was pouring rain outside but hey savvy-traveler me knew the hotel was only 2.5 blocks away -- which woulda been great had I not looked at Clark St in reverse and instead headed south (thinking I was going north) and then west (thinking i was going eat). Made for a 10+ block walk (wrong way and back to hotel) in pouring rain with luggage, backpack and groceries. When pathetic me, looking like a transient person (all wet and disheveled), entered the hotel, Tom Hilton at the front desk greeted me (I'm sure I was quite the spectacle). I was till a few minutes before official checkin time and the room type I was entitled wouldnt be ready right away but I was first on the list, Tom assured. I was fine with that, knowing I had a great rate and that i was early (I'm a reasonable traveler, nonsmoking room as I have allergies is my main requirement). The next thing i knew, Mr. Hilton was giving me my room key, I asked when I should head up there (thinking Id need to wait in the lobby a little) and he said go right up. I was amazed that he was so accommodating. It was greatly appreciated as some dry clothes were definitely needed after all that traveling and the rainstorm/mess. In general the room was great...yes they're a bit smallish but in line with Chicago and dont forget this building was built years ago as apartments/hotel so rooms cant be adjusted. In fact the recent renovations maximize the space for guests in my opinion ; it reminded me a bit of the Intercontinental in that regard. It was plenty big for me, extremely comfy bed, great art-deco decor and design, very well thought out in terms of amenities, guest needs (for example: the tray for goodies like snacks was great touch for breakfast or a meal in bed). Loved the hardwood floors too. The free in-room wifi was great in planning my Chicago out-and-abouts -- the free computer internet and printer in the basement was quite helpful for printing important stuff (boarding pass, directions, bus schedules, restaurant coupons etc) and was a nice touch. The staff was just very upbeat, warm and welcoming all the way around. Tom was awesome -- he even called after my checkin to see if everything was alright. The other front-desk folks was wonderful/friendly -- Lissa in particular. Also, housekeeping staff was awesome -- I actually didnt get housekeeping on all days, but the one on my floor was so nice; when she saw me coming from a distance, she even pressed the elevator button so there'd not be a wait (and the elevators are fast regardless). How thoughtful! When I get back to Chicago, this hotel will definitely be on my radar. Thanks to Tom and staff for an absolutely wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “The cutest little hotel on the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Indigo. I always use the Priceline "Name Your Own Price" option and I know that I always get the hotel WAY under market value. But, I always feel that I am being a little bit shunned because I booked through a discounter. If the Indigo doesn't like third party bookers, they shouldn't partner with them. Anyway, when we checked in the room wasn't ready. We asked how much it would cost to upgrade from a room with a Queen bed to a room with a King. She said the cost would be $30. We put our suitcases in the storage room and left for four hours. When we returned and checked-in, the cost to upgrade to a room with a King bed suddenly shot up to $75. I guess this is the only thing I don't like about the Indigo. I have the feeling if the entire hotel was empty and the guest booked through a third party, you would be assigned to the most undesirable room they have. ( That's my opinion, for what it's worth.) We LOVE the location of this hotel and the entire place is visually VERY unique and attractive. There is a Keurig coffee maker in the room and NO CARPET! A hotel room feels so much cleaner without carpet. And, it also feels a little European, too! We loved the free internet, also.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Johanna311
Reviews.Content: I recently met a friend in Chicago to celebrate her 30th birthday and we stayed at the Hotel Indigo. We had a great experience and I will definitely stay there again in the future. The hotel is charming, the staff is friendly, and the rooms are spacious. The best feature in my opinion though is its location. We took the â€˜Lâ€™ directly from Midway and got off literally a block from the hotel. We later took the â€˜Lâ€™ to Wrigley Field and it could not have been easier. Itâ€™s a really short and very safe walk from the hotel to Old Town where we enjoyed the restaurants and bars without having to worry about paying for a cab. The walk to Michigan Ave., Navy Pier, and Grant Park is not bad at all on a nice day. I have stayed just off of Michigan Ave. in the past and much preferred staying in a quieter and less crowded neighborhood. I canâ€™t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Retreat Feeling in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: CLETravel0626
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Indigo on a long weekend over the Fourth of July! We could not have been more satisfied with our decision. From the moment of check-in on a hot day with cucumber water, to checking in to a very nice sized room, to the convenience to the train going to the Cubs game! After the game we were able to come back to the hotel to relax before venturing out to Old Town. There are a lot of great trendy areas walking distance from the hotel and we were able to enjoy quite a few that evening. We will definitely stay at Hotel Indigo Chicago again....hopefully sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Scottyp34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend after visiting clients and let me tell you, Hotel Indigo Chicago nailed it for my business and leisure needs. The location is perfect, close to the trains, beaches, the loop and Mag. Mile. We were able to see the city by walking, instead of taking cabs. The service was excellent from the doorman to housekeeping and everyone else. Great colors throughout and nice fitness area with spa services. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The best business travel experience yet!”
Reviews.Author: Tuscanydreamz
Reviews.Content: The moment you pull up on this beautifully tree lined street, you find you have discovered a hidden treasure. Entering the fabulous 'beach style' lobby you are greeted with the warmest of welcomes from a knowledgeable, courteous and obviously happy staff. The rooms are spacious, meticulously clean, bright and cheerful with a bed you don't want to get out of! Starting the day off with a refreshing spa shower complete with Aveda products, healthy restaurant options and Starbucks coffee, you are ready for a short but lovely walk to the office in downtown Chicago. Conveniently nearby are numerous restaurants offering everything Chicago has to offer. If shopping is on your list...and it should be....the upscale shops (Tiffany, Ralph Lauren, Anne Fontaine, Nike, etc) are located within walking distance. You can also stroll along Lake Michigan and enjoy a lovely sunrise or sunset. I highly recommend this beautiful 'urban oasis' hotel. In addition, I recieve IHG Priority Club Reward points every time I stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Small but decent stay for a 3 day getaway”
Reviews.Author: bri0831
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here summer 2010 for a quick Chicago getaway. Located on a nice street with a great little diner spot next door & a Walgreens on the other corner. The room was a little small (but it's an old building) but there was free WiFi (just called the front desk for the password.) In room safe, updated bathroom as well. No fridge in room but the ice machine was a couple floors down from where we stayed (10th floor.) The bartender helped us bring all bags up to our floor which was nice, and really wasn't his job so that was cool. We relied on cab rides to eat, and to the Rush Street area, but it was worth the price on Hotwire. I would stay again, but probably would stay closer to the bars & restaurants, etc. Not a bad stay, gets the job done for not a ton of $$ (and the showers had lots of hot water!)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Priceline Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: pgupta1
Reviews.Content: Had booked on Priceline. Traveled with a colleague and needed two beds. That costs extra money here, making the Hotel a rather average deal, and unexpectedly pushing your price up when you have no option. Try your luck elsewhere if two adults not keen on sharing the same quite small queens bed travel together.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms tiny, tiny bed for 2 people, worst of all unfriendly unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: shivne
Reviews.Content: SO I got this hotel on priceline which of course means paying less but at $125 I expected something decent. I was had no choice of beds in the room and had no choice ot but to take a TINY room with a QUEEN bed. I was with a perspn I couldnt share a bed with so I had to sleep on the floor. When I asked if a twin room was available they said no problem...if I paid an extra $50. I asked if a KING bed was available...again....$50 extra. At $175 plus tax I could stay in a 4 star hotel. The receptionist was rude. Worst priceline hotel experience of my life. 3 days later i am staying at Hyatt Regency in an enormous room with 2 beds and friendly staff for $65. Ah the joys of priceline. I do not recommend the Indigo or it's money grabbing ways.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: BestPlacesintheUSA
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Indigo! It is tucked away in a more residential area but still walking distance to Michigan Avenue and even Navy Pier for those willing to do a bit longer walk. The building is older but that adds to the charm, and it's very clean and updated. The rooms (and decor in general) are so cute, and the service was fabulous! Lissa at the front desk went the extra mile for us looking up some information. The free wi-fi is a plus, too. They also had complimentary Keurig coffee and tea in the room. Overall, we couldn't have asked for a better stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, there are WAY better places in central Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: JohnVanderslice
Reviews.Content: This place is undermined by rude service and torpedoed by a bizarre and highly unusable and hideous "Coastal" decor. Terrible showers, small rooms, bad food and extremely rude front desk help. I am not sensitive, nor did I expect all that much (I got the rooms on Priceline) but even for $59 we felt ripped off. They sell Minute Maid OJ for $4.24 in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GReatTraveler0128
Reviews.Content: Well located in a very old neighborhood, yet not out of the way, but north of the loop in the Gold Coast area. (South of Lincoln Park). Very convenient to good places to eat. Food is pricey in the hotel, but the service staff is great (especially Fred!). We had a small room on the 14th floor, but will opt for a larger one next time. Note that the parking is pricey ($37 per day) and, that you CANNOT lock your car whether you park it or use valet parking! We had a handicap plate, which permitted us to park in a spot across from the entrance - all day, no charge. You are within walking distance of North State Street with many eateries and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so good hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lmasterz
Reviews.Content: I called in ahead of time asking for an early check-in and they said they'd be able to accommodate me which was great. Upon arrival, I was informed that I had a Queen bed, so I asked if can get 2-beds or a king bed. Apparently that would cost me $40 and $20 per night respectively. I needed it, so I upgraded. I've stayed in 4-star hotels in Chicago, none of which have such policy. Once entering my room, on the third level, the heater was already turned on to the max for a while and there was a foul odor which we couldn't tell where it was coming from. We took care of it by turning off the heater and opening the windows. Didn't bother complaining as we didn't have time. At around 7pm I asked the receptionist if housekeeping is available, as I needed one for my room. He said yes, they stop at 10pm. Instead of offering to contact them, he asked me to contact them from my room, which we did, and had to leave a voice-mail, which we did, yet the room wasn't serviced that day. Parking is $37 for 24 hours (using the parking next door), which is only $2 discount from the original $39. I don't see the point. Pros: Free wifi (and computer business center), printing, nice bathroom and shower. There are other better 3-star hotels around the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area, but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: rache2428
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Chicago to celebrate our 5th anniversary and stayed at this hotel. Hotel Indigo is in an excellent location. It's in a nice quiet area but within a 15 minute walk of shops, food, and some great bars! Staff was polite, service was great, and the room was smaller but decorated in soothing bright colors. We got a great deal on the room and they even let us check in early without any hassle. Parking was right next to the hotel for $39/ 24 hours, which isn't bad for Chicago, and the valet staff was fantastic! Only downside is that there is no pool, which would have been bit of a bummer for the kids, but there are plenty of kid-friendly activities to do in the area to keep them busy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit and stay at Hotel Indigo”
Reviews.Author: Greenfrog86
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I wanted to visit the sites and do some shopping in Chicago. We have been wanting to try a Hotel Indigo because of the attractive decor. We had a room with double queen beds. The room was very clean and bright. We were on the 8th floor facing the front of the building which provided a nice view towards the buildings on the lake. The room was not huge, but had everything we needed including a comfy chair and ottoman, desk and coffee machine. We did not visit the hotel restaurant, fitness area or spa. It was a short walk to Rush street and a slightly longer walk to the Magnificient Mile. There is valet public parking right next to the hotel with in/out privileges which was very convenient. This was a separate charge at a rate of $37/24 hours. There are drug stores, coffee shops and restaurants on the same block. The staff was very helpful with our questions. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Indigo Great Service Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Qwikblip
Reviews.Content: What a terrific location and property. Was upgraded to a larger suite for a 5 night stay. View of Lake Michigan from room. Easy walking distance to Michigan Ave., went on daily walks on the beach every morning when we stayed at the Indigo last summer- it's just a few blocks and easy walk. Bathrooms are small, note this is a historic property and not a modern high rise.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with customer service”
Reviews.Author: Joy096
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline. When I called the hotel to confirm my reservation I requested a room with two beds. They wanted to charge me $50 to do this! I didn't end up having to pay that much, but they did charge me for two beds. I have pricelined hotels with more stars all over the country and have never been charged extra for a room with two beds. This is absolutely ridiculous. Now I am paying the same price that I would have paid for a nicer hotel right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Feels like home not your typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindakay224
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and loved it. Yes the rooms are small but they are very nice and comfortable. It feels like staying in a guest room at family's house instead of a hotel. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryLollen
Reviews.Content: Room was small but nicely furnished and the hotel has an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “They went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Sixteen16-6
Reviews.Content: Booked the suite for my daughters "sweet 16th birthday". The hotel staff arranged a limo ride for us from O'hare airport and handled all details with great care. My daughter entered our suite to find balloons and a birthday cake awaiting her in a beautiful suite with a great view! The balloons and cake were NOT prearranged and the staff did this on their own....thank you! Did I mention the room was ready early too! Wonderful recommendations from the staff for shopping and dining. Not a hitch in the stay and would love to do it again. I am a hero to my 16 year old daughter. Thanks Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “In the midst of the 3rd biggest blizzard in Chicago history, here is where to be!”
Reviews.Author: JWB330
Reviews.Content: My friends and I arrived the day after the 12011 Chicago blizzard to attend Moody Bible Institute Founders Week. The Hotel Indigo exceeded our expectations in every way - delightful, colorful decor to warm us, Veronika at the desk to help us in every way, the doorman and manager who took our bags (sorry I don't know your names). The rooms were comfortable and spacious, lots of hot water with firm pressure, Starbucks coffee in the lobby, and a fabulous restaurant 3 buildings down where we took every meal. In the midst of all the stresses and inconveniences from the blizzard, everyone bent over backwards to make us welcome. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “The staff and hotel was absoluetly wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: miller317
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo was a great getaway for my friend and I. Scott was very helpful in planning my trip by holding luggage if we needed it and was flexible with the dates that I wanted to stay. It was close enough to walk to the magnificent mile for shopping and to other great Chicago attractions. Tom at the front desk was very helpful in giving us directions to find everything we needed during our stay. The hotel and room was amazing in the color combinations and we were fortunate enough to have a view of the lake from our room. Lisa the front desk clerk at night was able to help us with directions and gave us some very good delivery options. Hotel Indigo went above and beyond and this is a stay I will never forget and cannot wait to stay there again! Thank you to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “A real special treat for a Chicago visitor”
Reviews.Author: illyman
Reviews.Content: You feel like you are at home. Warm, friendly environment, with a really clever decor. The staff is very welcoming and helpful...yet, low key. The location is a bit off the main drag, but close enough and the peace and quiet is refreshing. You are actually in a neighborhhood and it gives you a real feeling for Chicago. Great value...highly recommend you try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Staff Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelgrl1
Reviews.Content: I am in the hotel business so naturally more critical than the average traveler and finally a hotel that exceeded my expectations! It has been a while since I have stayed at a hotel with genuine caring staff and clean rooms. The location is perfect in a great neighborhood and walking distance to many attractions or jump on the CTA just around the block. I arrive early afternoon on a Sunday and was able to check in early with no problems and even was provided with a surprise upgrade! The room was clean and bright. I did not feel like I was in a standard hotel room, but rather a studio apartment. They do not have flat screen TV's, however I think by the end of the year it will be required. Free WIFI and good business center and fitness center. Each time I walked into the lobby or past any employee I was always greeted with a smile and hello. Checkout was a breeze and Tom at the desk was super nice and genuine. I will stay here again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly quaint for two, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nellethon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for the weekend and had a superb time, largely in part to this hotel - very clean, helpful and friendly staff, vibrant colors/ambiance (yet very relaxing) and fab location. So easy to get to from the airport - blue line to red line and voila! a grocery store, convenience store, coffee shops, etc - all nearby! less than a $10 fare to the Navy Pier, and because it was cold we took a $5 cab to the bars Saturday night, otherwise easily in walking distance. plenty of cabs, plenty to eat, drink, see, do... i love this area! The hotel was spotless (and I am very particular about cleanliness and "germ-free!"), comfy beds, good room temp control, space to put your bags, coats, etc. I noticed my skin was quite dry - not sure if it was because of the water or the cold temps, but the Aveda lotion was definitely used! The workout room was great as well, as were the quick elevators and welcoming lobby. The man at the front desk, Tom, was very kind and helpful, as were all of his coworkers. I was very impressed and will, without a doubt, stay here again. they even allowed us to take advantage of a late checkout (2 PM) as well as an early check in - at 10 AM! It's hotels like this that make traveling a breeze and add to the overall enjoyment. Thanks for the great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in an upscale neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PacerJim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just two blocks from the Red Line stop at Division/Clark, so it's only 10 mins from the Loop. I was on business and didn't need too much, just a quiet room and free wifi. The room design looks like you're staying at Key West. It was nice and clean. The bathroom was clean. Just a brief walk up the street to the corner restaurant where I got a great meal. I'd stay here again. The only drawback was that the HVAC was a wallbanger, not central.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep, rooms are small, hotel has a very chic feel”
Reviews.Author: ColetteAndJim
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about 10 times over the last few months, and will continue to stay here. The hotel is a bit outside of the loop, and it can be difficult to catch a cab occasionally in the morning. Great on-site fitness center, with multiple nice machines, 2 treadmills, a bike, a stair stepper and a small selection of free weights. The staff is friendly, although I've had very little interaction with them other than check-in/check-out. Rooms are clean to an 8/10 - some mildew spots on the ceiling of my shower last night and there are little details here and there that should be tended to, but good overall. Would like coffee in the lobby, but that would take away from their little coffee shop at the back of the hotel. There's a Jewel-Osco grocery store around the block if you like to buy groceries (no fridge or microwave in the room though), and the CTA Red line is around the corner also if you prefer to catch the train to downtown rather than cab. Jim & Colette http://www.roamingtogether.com http://www.facebook.com/followrt

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: langais
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 3 month old baby. The staff wasn't very friendly, but the room made up for it. The room was very clean and comfortable. You can find the hotel very easy at night because the outside is lit in blue. It's very cute. Overall, I would stay here again. And, would highly recommend visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hmk85
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The decor is fun and different, the rooms are super cute, the beds are incredibly comfortable, and they use Aveda products for their amenities. I'd reccommend the Hotel Indigo to anyone staying in Chicago for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Far north location, teeny tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: sisholm
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire for a last minute trip to the City for the weekend and got this hotel. It was described as "Michigan Ave, Gold Coast". It is definitely Gold Coast, as it is quite a walk from here to Michigan Ave in the winter. It is only 3 blocks from the Rush St. action, so it would be a good choice for someone looking for a hotel close to that. The room was very tiny. My husband said it was really more of a bedroom than a hotel room. There was not even a place to hang a full length coat. I would not choose this location again in the future, there are too many other well located hotels with bigger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place & good location”
Reviews.Author: rf06903
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a redo of an older hotel. The king size bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed reading and relaxing in the armchair and ottoman. The fitness center is being remodeled so it was fair but usuable for a little cardio during our 4 night stay. Since we were there to visit our daughter the location was perfect - a block to the Clark St bus to Lincoln Park. Walkable to Magnificent Mile and Michigan Ave shopping. Convenient to public transportation, resturants and the Chicago History Museum. The surrounding area is a very pretty residential neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: fligirl
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, nice rooms, great location. I'd only recommend that you try to get a room other than the one next to the service elevator. But boy, you really can't beat the location and friendly, knowledgeable staff, like Anna.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Comfy Rooms, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dalinka
Reviews.Content: Chicago is my hometown so when choosing a hotel there I need to be close to transport and away from tourists. This hotel fits the bill to a tee! It's located on a quiet residential street that's very close to the red line train and several key bus routes. You're about the same distance from the Loop (i.e. business) and North/West sides (i.e. fun). The room I got was a King with a little sitting area which was very helpful for work. The bed was comfy cozy, as was the armchair. I appreciated the bright colors and general decor, as well as the Aveda toiletries. Only minor complaint was the bathroom vent that sounded like a jet engine while the accompanying light was pretty dim. The WiFi in the hotel was stellar! It's free and strong throughout the building. And the staff is friendly and competent. All in all very comfy hotel at an excellent price for the area!

Reviews.Title: “good value handy location”
Reviews.Author: tincase
Reviews.Content: This place turned out to be very practical for us for three nights in Chicago. Close to a red line station and a few bus stops. The staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms are small but the beds were very comfortable. We had no complaints at all and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jermjerm
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms along with friendly helpful service at the front desk. This hotel is also in a great location. My husband and I stayed over the Labor Day weekend and very much enjoyed our stay! The front desk was very professional and went out of their way to be helpful with great suggestions for things to do in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location and Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: TonnaK
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was professional yet friendly, a great combination in my opinion.I absolutely loved our room. It was so comfortable! The room felt more like a room in a home than a hotel establishment. Beautifully decorated, well arranged, emaculately clean. Bed and pillows were oh so comfortable. The view out the window had a exciting (exciting to me because i think Chicago skyline is the best from any angle, hands down) partial view of the Chicago downtown skyline...I could actually see Sears Tower (I know the name changed but as Chicago is my hometown, it will ALWAYS be Sears Tower, never Willis, yuck, I digress). The Location is perfect if you want to have access to downtown Chi...u can walk to so many places, or a short inexpensive cab ride to highlights of the city I love. There are sooo many delicious eating establishments in walking distance. Next door to the hotel is a well known delicious pizzeria (one of the many good ones in Chicago) Edwardo's. How convenient to order a deep dish pizza, take the elevator downstairs, walk next door to pick it up. Also down the street you have an opportunity to treat your tastebuds to a Dee-licious Chi-Town style hot dog. A block in either direction and you'll run into some delicious restaurants, from steak houses, to breakfast places, jazz clubs. The short distance to Magnificient Mile (Michigan Avenue) is also a plus. I love just walking down the Magnificient Mile, taking it all in, the shops, the architecture. The hotel was a short cab/long walk to State Street, Grant and Millenium Park, The Art Museum. I cant' say enough about this hotel and location. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel or location. The hotel even has a gym, small but adequate, which will come in handy if you decide to enjoy all the culinary delights that Chicago has to offer. Also on the hotels first floor two choices are offered in regards to food and drink. We enjoyed breakfast in one of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, fresh decor”
Reviews.Author: jeeplisa
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I first stayed in Hotel Indigo in Atlanta, GA, and LOVED it so I figured I'd give it another shot. This one did not disappoint. The location is a bit far from downtown, but you're right by the L, so it's really not bad. The beds are amazingly comfortable, the decor is bright and fresh, the rooms are fairly spacious (although a small bathroom). The service was ok. They were not rude at all, but no overly nice either. I would definitely stay in this hotel again if I were headed back to Chicago. :)

Reviews.Title: “Gold Coast is a beautiful area for this beach themed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn70820
Reviews.Content: Rooms were really small but clean. This littlehotel is not far from Lake Michigan, which explains it's beach theme. Lots of indigo blue and lime green are used thoughout the rooms. Service was a bit spoty. We had to ask for coffee, towels or glasses EVERY day. Thankfully, staff responded quickly. One staff member booked me on a tour and said I had plenty of time to walk, which was not the case. I missed my noon tour but was able to catch a 1pm tour that same day. She was about 20 years old and I am nearly 60 which could explain the difference in our walking abilities. All of the staff were friendly. Something we really enjoyed was the location. Though it is not in the heart of the city, it is easy to get places from this site using public transportation. We loved walking though the Gold Coast neighborhoods, taking photos of the homes and meeting residents with their adorable dogs. The weather was perfect and everyone was outside enjoying all sorts of activities. An added bonus was the wonderful Farmer's Market that took place on Saturday morning, just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but the size of the room was small.”
Reviews.Author: donnasha23
Reviews.Content: This was a great small, sort of boutiquish hotel. It is located directly in the gold coast and the shopping/dining is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “I am in awe of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lunita2010
Reviews.Content: The room was artfully decorated and had the most comfortable bed ever. I copied the name of the mattress & pad to buy them at home. The location was CTA close with lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. The service was incredible! One day we went to the parking lot and realized we'd left something in the room. By the time we'd walked back, the room was perfectly done, cleaned, replenished, everything in minutes. The very best was the kindness, friendliness and helpfulness of the staff at the desk. Rhonda, Veronika and Mr Hilton (real name) went out of their way to help us find all the Chicago sites we wanted. A huge hug to them all! We'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but watch out for the fire escape view”
Reviews.Author: ads8qd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel off Hotwire. I am usually a priceline.com bidder, but it was not working for this trip. We knew the hotel it was going to be thanks to hoteldealsrevealed.com. We liked the feel on the Indigo. It was clean, in a great neighborhood, and had a boutique/residential feel. The only complaint was our 11th story window that look out into a fire escape, the hotel was not full and I do not know if that was our punishment for only paying $99 per night and wanting a king or not, Other than that the room was great however if paying full price make sure you are not one of the ten rooms with a courtyard view of the fire escape.

Reviews.Title: “I recently stayed in this hotel when I...”
Reviews.Author: Adlai
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel when I was displaced from my apartment due to a smoke fire. It could not have been a better experience. Though it is a boutique hotel located in the most charming neighborhood in Chicago, the comfort level of the bed and the beautiful colors of the decor matched the 5 star experience of the better known Michigan Avenue hotels. Stay away from the Ambassador East and stay here. As a bonus, Salpicon is two blocks away for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent traveler - this one on my top three”
Reviews.Author: noack57
Reviews.Content: I travel to a different hotel every two weeks for business, this time I was able to bring my Spouse and take some time off. This property is nesteled in a quiet neighborhood, however walk just a few city blocks and you have a large variety of restaurants and shopping to choose from including Chicago's Watertower place. You can go a few blocks and walk or run along Lake Shore Drive and Lake Michigan. The property I believe is an old apartment building , renovated and turned into a charming hotel with a most relaxing and welcoming feel. Rooms have GREAT beds and wonderful Decor that make you feel like you are at a upscale B&B not a regular hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a nice area of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: EdenPraireMom
Reviews.Content: Boutique Hotel is the key word. If you are looking for a big chain name hotel, this is not the one. It is an older (Clairage Hotel) that has been updated. It is smaller, but that is not bad. The lobby serves it's purpose. There is a little bar that is open until 11:00. Front desk staff was very nice and polite. Very Nice! The halls are narrow, but that didnt bother me. There were some condidtions of wear on the carpets in the hallways. Just need to be cleaned or replaced. The room had two beds and a sitting area. The bathroom had a sink and a toilet and shower. Sink and counter space was small, but it worked. Recently updated. Shower was nice! The wood floors are a nice change, but there was a spot where the finish was starting to peel up. Colors are bright blue and orange (at least in my room). Not my taste, but again, it was fine. The hotel is located in a quiet residental area. Lots of young and old safe people walking at all times of the day. I felt safe. I would recommend this hotel and would be fine if I had to stay at Hotel Indigo again. I would give this a 3 star rating or maybe a 3 1/2 star rating, but not a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Tom Hilton eptiomizes what your hotel projects”
Reviews.Author: AAPILOT50
Reviews.Content: Hi I am Terry Dyson American Airlines Pilot. I stayed at your lovely hotel on September 4th 2010. The reason I am writing is that while on an arduous 6 day trip between the US and Europe Tom Hilton helped me more than I thought possible. I had destroyed 2 of my uniform ( white ) shirts with a shaving accident that would not stop, and a leaking ink pin. I called downstairs upon check in early afternoon Saturday the 4th. I loaded up the shirts and asked could they be laundered. Tom said he was not sure but would do his best to get them done before our check out the next day at 1830. He admitted that it might be expensive to accomplish the cleaning. So I brought them down ASAP and left them with him. The next day I came to collect the shirts at front desk and the clerks told me that try as he might Tom could not get any laundry to clean and press the shirts. The clerk walked away to the back office at the Indigo and came out with both my shirts hanging, clean and pressed.........Tom was off duty but he and his wife had taken my shirts home and personally worked them over the night. He then came in on his own time and left them for me to pick up. No charge !!!! Blood stains out of the white and 99% of the ink out too ! I cannot thank Tom enough for saving my professional appearance and his actions remind me of why I became a airline pilot...because we care to provide service over and above expectation or immediate income ! Thanks to Tom Hilton and his wonderful spouse ! You made my day. Sincerely, Terence Dyson DFW based 777 First Officer International, American Airlines.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing, but a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: efitravelor
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights over labor day weekend and had a really nice time. very quiet neighborhood, but one night we had to close the windows because the sirens were almost constant (fire trucks) obviously not the hotel's fault. slightly worn, but you can see they try hard to keep it clean. we had a really nice corner room with extra room which was nice. my biggest complaint was the shower did not drain well. we reported, but they were not able to fix. i love old historic hotels that have been restored, so this was a treat. silly comments about narrow hallways are not valid. staff really was bend over backwards nice and very accomodating. we loved the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelorperson
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked this hotel through priceline and got a "deal" for a double queen. The check in was 4pm. We got there 30 minutes early, around 3:30.
