As we were checking in, the staff told us that our room was already given to someone else. Shocked, we asked how that could've happened when we've already got the confirmation. They informed us that there were some miscommunications between the staff but they'll have the maids clean another room for us. We could've just went elsewhere, but we decided to "be nice" and wait. Finally after more than an hour of waiting, another room was cleaned for us. On top of that, they charged us an additional $50 for another bed! After all the terrible customer service, the least they could do was waive that extra bed fee, since the deal we got thru priceline was for a double queen. They didn't even care to apologize for their mistake!! And the so called Valet parking is a total rip off and annoying as ever just to get a staff to come park your car. Customer service is absolutely terrible in every sense! Everything about this hotel is just garbage! save your hard earned money! BOOK ELSEWHERE!!!! AND YOU BET I'VE ALREADY TOLD ALL OF MY CO-WORKERS AND FRIENDS NOT TO BOOK AT HOTEL INDIGO IF THEY GO TO CHICAGO!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOUGHVIEW
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the funky decor, obliging staff and a super location close to the shopping and amusement action and a short walk from the lakeshore beach. SIR KENNETH BLOOMFIELD, NORTHERN IRELAND

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Amiller101
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. Perfect location, very clean, helpful staff........ especially Tom, who went above and beyond to make sure my husband and I were comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “The Indigo Hotel is PERFECT for a nice get-away stay!”
Reviews.Author: stevegrein
Reviews.Content: I travel A LOT and while on a weekend away I wanted to stay somewhere a little different that the normal looking and feeling hotels. Indigo is in a quaint little section of Chicago, close to everything. PLENTY of restaurants and bars close by. Staff was incredibly friendly and the hotel was cute, clean and quiet! The bed was comfy and the room was colorful with a nice touch of hardwood floors. I REALLY recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: momdecor
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and relaxing location. It's expensive to stay, but lucky for us we had a special rate because we were in town for a wedding. Very clean and very nice employees. Within walking distance of many good places to eat. Little place to eat at hotel, but expensive and not very much food given to you. Would stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Snilloc737
Reviews.Content: Traveling on business, I stay at The Hotel Indigo quite often. I'm always well pleased with my stay much due to the great front desk staff... more particularly Lisa and Tom. Always going above and beyond to make me comfortable and assure a good restful stay, I cannot speak highly enough of these folks.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, loved the decor!!”
Reviews.Author: patayla
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline therefore did not know what we were bidding on, other than a 3 star hotel in the North Michigan Ave area. For the most part we were very pleasantly surprised! I would almost say this is either a 3 star plus or even a 4. I thought the rooms were extremely cozy and trendy and the bed was to die for! It was the best nights sleep I'd had in a long time. I was impressed with the free internet in the rooms, most upscale hotels charge extra. The area was a little out of the way, and at first we thought it was in a bit of a seedy area but it turned out to be okay. I would definately stay here again and would also recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is #1 at Hotel Indigo”
Reviews.Author: Sandtravel2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a four day stay in the Hotel Indigo and I cannot say enough good things about the exceptional service we received during our stay. We booked on Hotwire and got a fantastic deal. Before heading off on our trip, I contacted the hotel directly and asked for a non-smoking room with a king sized bed. My request was responded to by Angie, and honoured immediately - this was a great start to our vacation. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted with a warm smile and very attentive service by Lisa. If you are looking for something a little different than the large, impersonal hotel experience - then you cannot overlook this gem. Our room was a good size, very clean and bright. The king-sized bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had Aveda products - a nice surprise! We had a sitting area with current magazines, two chairs, t.v., and desk. I was pleased to find both an ironing board and coffee maker in the room - as some boutique hotels do not offer these. If like me, you like to be treated like a valued customer, then this is the hotel for you. Everyone, housekeeping, reception, concierge and security were friendly, personable and made you feel welcome. On our way home I discovered my husband (men eh!!), had left our GPS in the night table. I called the hotel and was immediately transferred to Anna who assured me the GPS was safe with her and they would return it to me via mail. This is service I have simply never experienced before!!! I highly recommend this hotel to you if you are looking for something a little different that will not cost an arm and a leg, yet with all you could wish for - that perfect get-away.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best bidding website deals ever”
Reviews.Author: Rrr_DC
Reviews.Content: Great location for sightseeing, shopping, nightlife, anything important for the Windy City! The staff is more than nice, happy to give advice, help with the luggage and birng additional cosmetics in a minute. Well... I guess the best luck that we have ever had when bidding for the hotel. I would recommend it for both business and private trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, However, disappointment with the room.”
Reviews.Author: Mac1224
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Hotel Indigo from July 22-25. The hotel is in a great location only about a block from the red line. Stayed in a small room with queen bed that was adequate for the two of us. We stayed on the fourteenth floor. That was our only problem. Chicago had heavy rains Friday night and a significant amount of water leaked into the room. So much that it soaked our clothes in our one bag. We notified the staff the next day. We were told that a staff member would look into the situation. We did not hear from anyone that day. Upon leaving the following day, we informed the staff of the problem again and waited for about 30 minutes to speak with someone regarding the situation. After 30 minutes we had to leave in order to be on time for our flight. Everything else was fine. We had just hoped for a little more follow through by the staff and management regarding the leak. We are not very critical people and can look beyond issues like this. Therefore, due to location and our needs we would still recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Darkwolf242
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and my best friend. My mom, she actually works here. They hotel was great! The rooms were very clean and even though the hotel doesn't have a pool, you can go to the beach. The spa was also great. Chicago looks beautiful at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky US!”
Reviews.Author: rogerandvirginia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was top notch on all levels! Location is perfect in a quiet area of Chicago. Walking distance to everything. The staff was so accomadating. Almost felt like they were our friends welcoming us "home" everyday. We upgraded to a suite. It was twice the size of the regular rooms. 2 yummy queen beds. Soft linens and pillows. Our room was very clean and spacious. The colors are bright. The room felt like a beach room in the middle of the city! Courtesy business center a added plus. My husband works for the airlines. We travel alot. This hotel was a great place for my best friend and I to visit for a long shopping weekend. We will for sure return. If you're looking for a Botique hotel, look no further, you have found it! Pass it up, well, it's your loss.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo is a really cute hotel with awesome service - great location too”
Reviews.Author: lkmueller6821
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at Hotel Indigo while I was traveling on business. From the time I checked into this hotel until I left the service was incredible. The front desk staff was very accommodating, even the director of sales left me an umbrella in my room when he learned it was going to rain and I didn't pack an umbrella. The bellman had a cab waiting for me each morning and room service was quick and my food was very tasty. The setting of the hotel is on a cute residential street, you forget you are in downtown Chicago with the brownstones all round you. You are also within walking distance to some wonderful restaurants and shopping and just a short cab ride to the heart of downtown. I most definitely would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: washington_wahine
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Hotel Indigo. What a pleasure to be at this well-kept secret. The location is central - walking distance to Water Tower, a few blocks from the lake, several good restaurants on the same block, large drugstore on the corner for those pesky things you forgot.... It's also convenient to the red line train for an inexpensive way to get around the city. We ate several times at the Third Coast Cafe down the street and had good food and wine at reasonable costs. The decor is fresh and cheery - doesn't feel "big city" but more coastal as it's on the Gold Coast I suppose. There is Aveda product in the bathroom (don't have to bring my own!), a coffee service on the side, and they will bring up a fridge if you need one. The rooms are large with a separate table/sitting area and enclosed shower/toilet area. A few negatives or personal dislikes: there was no ability to crack the windows and at times the hotel had funky odors in the hallways and room. The air conditioner is a bit noisy and cycles on and off repeatedly. My son was unhappy at the few available channels in the room, but the basics are there. The pillows are hard and lumpy - next time I'll bring my own. Service is great and the bar and small cafe in the lobby were handy. Free wifi throughout the hotel. Staff is as attentive as ones you'd find in a luxury hotel. Price point is good for what you get. Look forward to staying here on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: CBurns1022
Reviews.Content: Three sisters in our 40's stayed at the Hotel Indigo for a one-night getaway. We just wish it could have been longer! We all enjoyed the hotel very much. It was very whimsical and cheery. Bright decor. Awesome beds/linens. Nice separate sitting area off the bedroom. Smaller bathroom but still very nicely decorated (no tub). Laminate floors (yea!) Friendly, helpful staff. The doorman that helped us with our luggage (sorry I can't remember your name) was absolutely wonderful. The gals at the front desk were spot on with their recommendations for dining/shopping. The location is great. The Red Line is close if you need to grab a train. There are many restaurants/bars just a short walk away. There's also a bar and restaurant on site, but we did not have the time to try either one. We'll definitely be back and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight”
Reviews.Author: bobbiMonterey
Reviews.Content: The room had a fireplace and great TV. It was lovely. The staff could not have been more helpful and the location is terrific. We stayed five nights, enjoyed breakfasts and the lovely bar in the evenings. We think Indigos are one of the best kept secrets.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: Runner969
Reviews.Content: Indigo is a great change from the typical hotel! My husband travels alot for business so I was looking for something different for our trip to Chicago. Our room was very cozy - we loved it. It was very clean and decor makes you smile. Gold Coast area is quiet farmers market was fun. walking distance to everything for us. Staff was friendly and very helpful. It will be the only place we stay when we visit Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Not your grandfather's hotel!”
Reviews.Author: upnorthjodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Indigo for this visit to Chicago because we were looking for something different from the typical Michigan Avenue mainstream chains. We chose the Hotel Indigo because of the awesome location. Chicago is a very walkable city and we took full advantage. Walking north to northwest takes you to OldTown with many great restaurants and bars. This area of town has a local feel to it. This walk is short and safe. Walking south takes you to Rush Street with many nightclubs and bars and some restaurants. A short walk east takes you to Michigan Avenue with its large scale shopping and very touristy restaurants. We even walked south to Grant park and the Art Institute. This is a little longer but still pleasant and doable for most people. The hotel itself had small pleasant rooms. The decor is contemporary and avant-garde. I loved the hard wood floors. Hard floors seem so much more sanitary in a hotel as compared to carpet. I wish more hotels would abandon the grubby carpet. The bed was comfortable. The room overall was clean. Some reviewers have complained about the blue decorating scheme. I agree that there was a plethora of blue. Blue is a warm and inviting color that has a calming effect on the viewer. It suggests excitement and possibilities without being startling or disturbing. I found the many shades of blue well thought-out and enjoyed the decorating scheme. If you don't like the color blue, don't stay here. We did not try the hotel coffee shop or restaurant. The lack of doorman or bell service or concierge was not an issue with us. I suspect that the hotel receptionists who checked us in would have assisted with bags or made dining recommendations had we asked. They were courteous and helpful in letting us into a room a few hours before check-in time. All in all a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay, Just as nice”
Reviews.Author: mm_chicago21
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel and for the price it can't be beat. I frequently travel to Chicago for work and this will be my hotel of choice going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: vonnegurl
Reviews.Content: We reserved a two night stay through Hotwire and were lucky enough to find this gem in the Gold Coast area. We ended up with a smoking room, which was the only one available, but the staff was kind enough to try to accommodate. When they could not, they sent up a box of candies with their apologies. The room itself did not have a lingering smoke smell, was small but charming. Staff was extremely helpful with directions and information any time we encountered them. The location was great, felt into the Gold Coat neighborhood, and very convenient to the Red Line, which we used to get to Wrigley Field. The free wi-fi came in very handy. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo Chicago was an all-around pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: Rebekahbelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were surprised at the decor, level of detail, and pleasant staff at the Gold Coast Hotel Indigo. Our room was great, the decor was fun, the staff was truly terrific--and fun. We'll stay there again when we go to Chicago, and I've already recommended it to friends."

Reviews.Title: “Neat place with cool shower”
Reviews.Author: waldorf579
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel while working in Chicago. I like the 'odd' style and the layout of the room. I had more than enough space and found the bathroom and shower cabin to be very cool. There were a seating area made out of teak tree in the shower which made for a comfy relaxing experience. The location in terms of Chicago is great, and most things are within walking distance. I thought I got great value for the money! I went out to party in the Chicago nightlife on the weekend, and had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “A clean boutique hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: UMWSUHFH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superficially attractive, but the rooms are too small for 2 people. The decor, while attractive is inexpensively done. The sound insulation is minimal if existent at all and the pillows leave much to be desired, although typical of inexpensive hotels. Make the assumption that your check in won't be until 4 pm since that is their policy. Given the above, the hotel is clean and well located. It is best suited for a single traveler. I would recommend it only if you understand its shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel , great location and teriffic staff!”
Reviews.Author: PACarys
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago last month and stayed at Hotel Indigo for the first time. We absolutely loved the hotel and would highly recommend it! The staff was WONDERFUL!! We arrived early...no problem. We couldn't get home to Pittsburgh due to the giant snow storm there, and the hotel was so great to us! We were able to keep our same room for 2 more days, and felt like the staff really cared about us, especially since our flight home seemed to change daily! The rooms were beachy and very refreshing in the cold winter! Plenty of room! Again a big thanks to Tom, Veronika and everyone else at Indigo for a great experience! Now our hotel of choice in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “cute and friendly”
Reviews.Author: NikiXO
Reviews.Content: Luckily, my hotwire hotel booking turned out to be the Hotel Indigo. Everyone was so nice and went out of their way to make my stay pleasant. The rooms are clean and cute; the beds are comfy. I had a much better hotel experience than some of my colleagues who stayed at other hotels for twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the most helpful and wonderful staff that I have had the pleasure to deal with.”
Reviews.Author: patcourt
Reviews.Content: After getting to Chicago late and very tired, I was so grateful to meet the staff at our hotel.. I had family staying there with their young children and the staff at this hotel all the way from the house keepers to the management was wonderful. It didn't matter what we needed or what directions we ask for, they were there to help with a smile... I would definitely recommended this hotel to my company for travel and anyone who ask... They made us feel special... I plan on taking my family back to Chicago in the summer and would never consider staying anywhere else...

Reviews.Title: “The experience at Hotel Indigo is always...”
Reviews.Author: Cpaoletti
Reviews.Content: The experience at Hotel Indigo is always wonderful to me. The staff is so friendly and helps with anything you need with nothing but a smile on their face. The rooms always look brand new. The location downtown is also great! Any place you wanna go is just a couple blocks away! I would recommend staying at this hotel to anyone traveling for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Fake from word go”
Reviews.Author: EyeTrvlAlot
Reviews.Content: If you are into fake wood floors, plastic smiles on the employees, cramped rooms with cheap furniture, and a "we try too hard to be cool" attitude... then this is your kind of place. The idea was appealing - but the execution was worse than poor. Impossible to relax after a long work day. The only thing this property has going for it is location... but right around the corner is a Holiday Inn Express. Which will be my choice next time I have to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Small and cozy”
Reviews.Author: deparker
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. I had a very small room but it was very cozy and welcoming. I like the decor and furnishings. The bed was comfortable and the amenities were nice. This is a neighborhood boutique type hotel but it is a short walk to the Mag Mile and clubs. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Indigo”
Reviews.Author: NashvegasLeo
Reviews.Content: I surprised my partner with a Christmas getaway to Chicago and wanted a nice hotel that was not "mainstream", but included all of the amenities. The Indigo fits the bill. I had not stayed here before, but would definitely stay again. The hotel is very neat with a "boutique/spa"atmosphere and very cool colors throughout. The rooms have unique furnishings and include I was pleasantly surprised that each room has a Keurig for the Keurig junkies like me. Free internet, Aveda toiletries top off the nicely equipped rooms. We spent the entire Christmas holiday and felt like that we were in a small hotel, although we were not. The pizza place just down the street has "excellent" pizza and the Red Line is just past the Starbucks.....what a GREAT Christmas!!! We definitely will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute but crowded rooms; customer service needs work.”
Reviews.Author: PageyMoon
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked this room through Hotwire and got a really good rate. It seemed like a cute, fun place for a girls' weekend. We were in town to catch some Blackhawks games and do some sightseeing. I arrived early and asked to check my suitcase, but they let me check in. I thought it was a little strange since the reservation was in my friend's name, but at the time, it made life easier on me, so I didn't care very much. Nor did I think anything of it when they asked for a card for incidentals. I asked what that meant, and I was told it was for things like room service. This came back to bite me. No one was there to grab the door or offer to take my bags, which was a little surprising at a hotel with this sort of rating. Everywhere else I've stayed in Chicago (Intercontinental, Hilton Chicago, Hotel 71) had at least one great doorman. I later found they hold $50 for each night of your stay, which can be a big problem if you're on a budget and/or using a debit card, like myself. When I checked my account and saw this $100 hold I wasn't expecting, I called to the desk to inquire what was going on. The girl on the other end was extremely rude and told me how there was a GIANT sign at the desk I should've read and that it's not their problem I didn't, and how I should be happy they did me a favor and only charged $50 for two of the three nights. Folks, I read everything I see. I even read the fine-print on the check-in paperwork to decline the 75-cent/day fee for the newspaper we wouldn't read. I saw no sign. When I next went down, I made a point to find the "giant" sign - a 4x6 piece of paper in a frame hiding behind a massive bowl of hard candy on the opposite side of the round desk where I checked in. I don't call that "giant." As my friend said, it's horrible customer service not to tell someone you're going to hold that much money. That particular staff member really left a bad taste in our mouths. At check-out, the people were much friendlier, offering to get us a cab (which we didn't need, but thanks), handed out coupons for Macy's and the 900 Shops, and got the door as we left. Thing is, coupons would've been better at the start of the stay when we had time left to go shopping and no one helped with any bags or doors when we arrived and were exhausted. Nice now, but it would've been nicer to have the service for the whole stay. One highlight was a staff member bringing up delivery menus for us late at night when we were hungry. The rooms aren't exactly small, their problem is way too much furniture. Two beds, a table with two chairs, an armchair and ottoman, bench, tv/coffeemaker table, nightstand, lamp table, side table, and a breakfast tray thing... and no space or dresser with drawers. Three girls need a place to put their stuff, and there just wasn't any room. We couldn't unpack anything, and we had to stack our suitcases in the closet then drag them out every morning. The bathroom is pretty tiny, and the shower curtain was too short, so the floor got wet each time we showered. There were some housekeeping issues that we couldn't stop laughing about, mainly the insanely dusty wall and the duvet with the cigarette burn on it that the maid didn't even bother to try and hide by folding it differently... after we left the card out asking for all the linens to be changed. I don't know if they're going for the "shabby chic" look or what, but the wood furnishings are looking pretty worm and busted. One bright spot is definitely the location. The hotel is on a residential street around the corner from a Red line stop. There is a 24-hour Walgreens at the corner, a Starbucks across the street, a couple of restaurants (try the barbecue chicken pizza at Eduardo's), and a cool "dive" bar called Mother's across from the Walgreens (where were saw a laughably horrible Led Zeppelin tribute). As internet-addicts, my friends and I were happy to see they offer free wireless internet. We were able to handle all of our online business from the comfort of our laptops and not in some uncomfortable "business center" room. That said, we did need to use their center, which is nothing more than two computers at a table with a printer, to print out some last-minute tickets. Printer was handy, but we had to mess with the computers to get one to go online, and then again to get it set up to the correct printer. I'm not sure if those issues were due to the staff not setting things up right, or if another customer had messed them up. Thankfully, we were computer-savvy. Overall, it's not a terrible hotel, but it's not a place I'd seek out again. One horrible staff member is all it takes to turn my friends and I off of a place, and the less-than-helpful desk lady certainly did it. For the price we paid, even with Hotwire, we can find somewhere else for next time.

Reviews.Title: “It's All True... Indigo Blue is for You!”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at this hotel in room 303 from December 8, 2009 to December 10, 2009. We were only in town for two days of sightseeing and to see a hockey game. I was very impressed with the accommodations and would highly recommend the hotel. I purchased a package deal on Expedia which included roundtrip airfare from New York, two nights, fees, and taxes for $625.00 total. Iâ€™m guessing I paid about $80.00 a night. Hotels in Chicago can be very pricey. However, if youâ€™re willing to stay just north of downtown, this is a good choice for you. The hotel is located just a three-minute walk from the Division/Clark red line train stop and a short walk to Michigan Avenue. The neighborhood seemed very safe with lots of restaurants and a Walgreens right down the street. To save money you can take the blue line train from Oâ€™Hare Airport to Division and take the 70 Bus to Division and Clark, all for about $2.00. If the weather is cold or rainy, take blue line to Jackson, transfer to the red line, and take the train heading towards Howard. Get off at Clark/Division. We bought a three-day CTA pass for $14.00 and went everywhere on the buses and trains, including both airport trips. The room was spacious and very clean. The television had a large selection of channels and two phones. The bed was very comfortable with nice pillows. The sheets were of a high quality. There was plenty of closet space and a large table to dine at. A negative to report about the room is that the toilet and shower were on the small side. The sink was outside the toilet/shower area so that was a plus. The water pressure in the shower was very strong and the water was nice and hot. There were plenty of towels and a hair dryer was provided. The complimentary soaps and shampoos were of a high quality. Maid service was very good. I enjoyed the blue color theme of the room. They had a decent alarm clock radio, not the cheap ones you might buy at 99-cent store. The room was not in a noisy area so youâ€™ll be able to sleep well. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Even if we had zero interaction with a particular employee, they still said hello and good-bye. I was very pleased to see that they provided two free internet stations 24 hours a day. We had some of their breakfast and it was pretty good. The dining area had very nice furniture to lounge on. They even microwaved some food we had from the night before. Overall, if youâ€™re looking to save money and want a good quality hotel stay, this is the hotel for you. You can pay 3-4 times as much staying at a Hilton or Sheraton in The Loop area, but a 5-minute train ride to the north side of Chicago will get you the same quality room for much less. Leave your car at home because parking can be very expensive and you can take the subways and buses anywhere. I would definitely stay here again. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful getaway”
Reviews.Author: billmelater123
Reviews.Content: I'd go back in a heartbeat! I took my daughter on a 15th birthday trip, just the two of us. We stayed at the Hotel Indigo, which reminded her of her favorite book, "Alice In Wonderland" as the chairs were oversized and the colors all bright blues and greens. The room was a bit small, but the service was great and the ambiance fun and friendly. Great location, with a great little cafe right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing fun close to the action!”
Reviews.Author: tomj1023
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay! Check in was a breeze. We got there early and the staff was very helpful, changing us from a non-smoking queen room to a king smoking room! The room wasn't ready yet so they held our bags for us and recommened places in the area to grab a drink & bite to eat. We came back and went to our room on the 4th floor just off of the elevator. I was worried that it would be very noisy, but it was not! :) The room was so comfortable and had everything we needed. I love the shower, lots of pressure & hot water. The hotel is located close to the action. Tons of places to eat, drink & shop close by. The Red Line is a block away and there were always taxis out front if you don't like to walk. You can take a short stroll and the Magnificent Mile is right there to do all the shopping you could want. There is plenty to see & do within blocks of the hotel. The hotel is located in a very residential area with beautiful old brownstones. The area was well lit and seemed totally safe to walk in. I would recommend the Indigo to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great decor-great staff”
Reviews.Author: FriendsWhoTravel
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for a long weekend with a group of 8 women who just wanted to see Chicago. The Hotel Indigo was located on a great street just blocks from the Metra but close enough to take taxis home at the end of the day or walk to Rush St. for great restaurants. On arrival, we were able to leave our bags so we could get the most out of the rest of the day & when we returned around 8 o'clock, our rooms were waiting & our luggage sent up. Since we were 4 in a room, they had given us their lager rooms right next to each other. We all loved the "beach decor" of the rooms, with the bright walls, white beds & furniture & large windows. All through our stay the staff at the front desk could not have been more helpful. They helped us arrange tours, get cabs for the airport and answered any questions we had with an eagerness to help. We qall loved Chicago & the Hotel Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: fincj19
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were impressed. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and the staff couldn't have been nicer. Our room was large and clean. The hotel was quiet. Located near the train so we didn't need to rent a car. I would highly recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, trendy hotel. . .just don't look too closely.”
Reviews.Author: Susan090
Reviews.Content: Fun,bold colors really make these hotel rooms pop. But don't look too closely or you'll discover that everything is put together rather cheaply. The shower walls are plastic made to look like stone. The polished hardwood floors are really particle type boards and so on. If we hadn't gotten this through Priceline, I would have been disappointed paying full price. We were fortunate and received a room with two queen beds. It was pretty spacious for a Chicago hotel. However, someone else in our party had only one queen bed and their room was TINY. Not too far from Lincoln park and the zoo. Parking is expensive but you get in and out privileges and it's only valet.

Reviews.Title: “very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeannicer
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two girlfriends for a girls weekend trip (we're in our 40s). The location is great and the staff was nice enough. There was a huge spill on the wall near the bathroom which they sent someone up right away to clean when we called about it. Cleanliness was average. We stayed in a standard two-bed room. The rooms are nothing special. They have a bright, European-type decor but are pretty standard otherwise. Nice to have a little table with chairs to sit at. Our room faced the street and it was nice to peer into the gorgeous apartments across the street! The breakfast area food did not look good and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: justinealexander
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say from the moment I arrived until when I left I felt very taken care of and I had a great experience. The Door man I am sorry I forgot his name but worked both nights was both friendly and knowledgable. Liza at the font desk was amazing! Upon my arrival she remembered that I had called earlier, checked me into a very nice room, called to make sure everything was great, and also the next night remembered my name and sent up some fruit and a card to my room! She is a great asset to this hotel. The hotel was beautiful but even if it was'nt the staff made my stay! Thank you! Justine Alexander

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: travelwriter99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very quaint, cozy and inviting. The rooms are adorable. They have free internet and printing which is great for being in the city. The rooms carry Aveda products which is another plus! Location is great...right next to bars and restaurants and the subway. It's a great location in the gold coast without paying expensive downtown chicago prices. The staff were helpful, esp. management. Very professional and when I complained about something they handled it right away both professionally and expeditiously with courtesy. That's a huge plus as management is present, visible and active. They also got me into my room right away despite checking in early and when their internet was down they let me use the one in their office so I could get some business emails sent. I would def. recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ladybeeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and were very pleased with the location of this hotel. Easy to get to anything we wanted to do. Lots of places within walking distance. The train is within a couple of blocks and is easy get anywhere. Convenience stores, restaurants and night life close by. Hotel is located in a nice, safe residential neighborhood . The staff was very attentive and helpful. We did not even bother with a car the whole time as it was not needed.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel - Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: finnbee
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Indigo upon realizing that my old, cheap, fav, Days Inn on N. Clark, had closed... Indigo was more expensive, but considerably less than other Gold Coast locations, with a parking ramp next door, and located one block from the subway. What a great surprise! With decor based on aesthetics, the Golden Mean, and art symbolism, the Indigo was a treat for the senses - funky, comfortable furniture, unique wall coverings, interesting spaces, awesome colors. It was more like visiting the comfortable home of an artist than staying in a hotel. The staff were wonderful. We've found a wonderful place to go back to in Hotel Indigo!

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with the service”
Reviews.Author: 49webb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights in Chicago and stayed at the Indigo in the Gold Coast area. This is a great area to stay as it is within walking distance to lots of great restaurants, the EL, and sights. This is why we chose the Indigo. It is a "cute" hotel and the doorman could not be more helpful. But it stopped with the doorman! My husband is a frequent traveller and we were upgraded to a "suite" on the 14th floor. Mind you, we knew beforehand the rooms were quite small and this also goes for our "suite" but it was fine for the 2 nights we were in town. We went out sightseeing in the morning and when we returned around 3 PM our room was still not serviced. We had to call the front desk for clean towels and when they still did not arrive, I had to find the attendant's cart and get my own towels, shampoo etc. Also, I woke up at night and stepped in a puddle of water from a malfunctioning air conditioner. We notified the front desk when we left in the morning and again, it was never attended to and once again there was a puddle of water near the bed which we used all the clean towels to mop up ourselves. I would recommend staying in this nice neighboor atmosphere, but don't recommend the Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: fishermanDallas
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for a weekend getaway. Jersey Boys, Great Food and Nightlife. The Hotel was really an afterthought but we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was the absolute best and our room was spacious and had a terrific view of the city. The neighborhood can't be beat - and we visit chicago a lot! I have never written a review before but my friends suggested that I tell you about my stay. "oh, what a night! ".

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mouldon
Reviews.Content: Great location, superior service, clean and comfy. With the great rate I got on Hotwire, I'd say there was no better option in Chicago in that price range. The folks at the front desk, the bellmen and the bartender were all very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is around tons of restaurants and bars in a very nice neighborhood and there are even a couple of drugstores and a grocery within a block or two. Only a four or five block walk to the lakefront. This was a perfect spot for our weekend getaway and we would definitely stay again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: RodP
Reviews.Content: Great price booking on-line, nothing fancy, no parking, great doorman and lobby staff.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: PastorMom
Reviews.Content: My family and I found this hotel on Priceline at the last minute and were pleased with the location and the price, but I'm glad I didn't pay any more than I did. The website gave the impression that they had double rooms with queens, double rooms with doubles, and king rooms. When I arrived, however, I was told that I had been given a single queen room. I asked if there was anything else available and was told that I could have a double queen room for an upcharge. When I asked if I could have a rollaway bed, also indicated on the website, the women at the desk said, "It already has two beds" and offered no other explanation. When I asked why that mattered, she said that it was against the law to put another bed in the room. Overall, she was very condescending and rude, a stereotypical "city snob." The room was nice but showed some wear. The fitness center had a diverse collection of equipment that was well-maintained. The best part about the hotel was its very convenient location. The only convenient parking option was the valet garage next door. The garage clearly gives discounts for patrons who get their tickets validated at about 10 nearby stores, but hotel guests pay full price--$37 for 24 hours. Rude staff, good location, but there are definitely nicer people and better places to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fitnessnut81
Reviews.Content: Staff was rude,room was dirty(there was poop in the toilet when i arrived), and i was given a different room than i had prev booked, then when i told them about the room they said i could have the room i had prev booked for an up charge........I will never stay here again!!!!!!!! There are soooooooo many nice hotels in chicago....But, this is not one of them!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best experience!”
Reviews.Author: BohemianWay
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I gifted our mother with a trip to Chicago for her birthday. We stayed at the Hotel Indigo May 12 and 13, 2009. We booked the hotel upon recommendation from a coworker of mine, and we were not disappointed. As a matter of fact, we adored the hotel and its staff! The hotel was bright, cheery and clean. The staff bent over backwards to be accommodating and friendly. We had to cancel our first reservation, but the person on the phone was happy to help us both times. We arrived early, prepared to check luggage and tour before checking in, but a room was immediately available, even fulfilling a request for a nice view. Two of the front desk receptionists learned our first names and called out greetings every time we entered the lobby. My mother had just recovered from skin cancer surgery, and these same women treated us as preferred guests, making sure we had everything we could possibly need, including a small refrigerator delivered to the room, a birthday balloon and cupcakes, a card wishing her well and happy birthday, and full directions to any sites about which we inquired. One night upon late return from eating way too much delicious food at Greek Islands restaurant on Halsted Street in Greektown, we wished for a soda. The machine was inoperative, and the night clerk noticed I was returning to the elevator with dollar bill in hand, but nothing else. She asked if there was something she could do, then dashed off to get complimentary glasses of iced soda from the lobby deli which was closed for the evening. We lacked for nothing! Several points of interest about the hotel include a CVS pharmacy with a pre-packaged fresh food and grocery section only half a block away, plenty of fast food and coffee shops within a blockâ€™s walk, a subway stop only one block away, a nice little internet nook with a working printer which was useful for hardcopies of last minute tour reservations, and a safe clean neighborhood location. Even though the hotel is close to the waterfront, and not the airport, we easily caught the subway directly from O'Hare to within a block of the hotel, with only one changeover at a centralized station. We did have to carry suitcases up stairs at the stop nearest the hotel, but that was not a problem for us. Perhaps another stop would have an elevator and then a short cab ride would get you to the hotel? CTA would be able to help with that question. The ride from the airport to the hotel was approximately 40 minutes, but we enjoyed seeing different parts of the city for the aboveground portions as we traveled. We purchased a three day subway pass with unlimited rides at the airport kiosk for fourteen dollars, so our transportation to and from the hotel was included in that price. What a bargain! (The pass is good for the subway and city buses. All were clean and efficient and easy to access.) We enjoyed the city immensely, its people were unbelievably genuinely friendly, and we definitely recommend the Hotel Indigo as the best place to relax and receive excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean room, friendly helpful service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyhr
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago at 1130am, too early to check in. Hotel Indigo reception gladly took our bags and stored them safely for us until it was check in time. When we returned to check in, a friendly hotel porter took our bags and led us to our room. On the way we asked where to find Goose Island Brewery and he didn't know but said he would check for us. Almost within minutes, someone fro the front desk rang our room to let us know where it was. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but rather small. We weren't looking to spend much time in the room as we wanted to see as much of the city as possible, so it suited us. The location was perfect, in a quiet neighborhood so we could sleep, but just around the corner within easy walking distance were several bars and restaurants. Easy access to the Clark/Division stop on the Red line.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schnook0831
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a fantastic stay at Hotel Indigo. It was unlike any hotel we had ever stayed at. The decor had a chic, beachy feel and we couldn't help but smile at all the warm and vibrant colors that surrounded us. It has a central location; is close to the Magnificent Mile, Lakeshore Drive and popular Rush Street. The staff was kind and offered their advice for the many questions we had since this was our first trip to Chicago. We are already looking forward to our next trip and we will definitely stay at Hotel Indigo again:)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is beautiful and "fancy" but everyone there very down to earth and we were comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: HBs_9
Reviews.Content: The elegance of this hotel was so unique but the staff were always available for any of our needs. We felt very much at home here and hope others learn of our secret of "Hotel Indigo." Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but an be a bit cheaper”
Reviews.Author: shadyf
Reviews.Content: the hotel is small and nice. staff are friendly. and it is in close proximity to the magnificent mile - the main attraction of the city. downsides: the breakfast options are soooo limited and the bathroom is small. The rate was around $250/night.. can be a bit better. overall... it is a good hotel if you plan to spend most of your time on the road between meetings and siteseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for girls' weekend out!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBug
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend from Tennessee and I stayed here after receiving a recommendation from my BIL who stays here frequently for business. We were going to stay way out in Oakbrook due to $$ issues, but we have absolutely NO regrets for spending a bit more and staying at Hotel Indigo. The location is perfect, perfect, perfect and the hotel itself is wonderful. We really enjoyed it. So much is convenient: Starbucks, a Walgreens, Dunkin Donuts, clubs, restaurants and the Red line of the CTA. I used the little workout room on Saturday morning and felt it was generously appointed for a hotel gym. Really enjoyed the decorating, room design, comfortable beds, and Aveda products in the room. The hotel staff were very helpful on Friday when I was driving in from Michigan and gave me a turn-by-turn to get to the hotel when I couldn't handle the freeway anymore. One note: maybe it's just because I'm small-town, but the parking price for the ramp next door is ridiculous. I spent $78 from Friday pm to Sunday at noon. Next time, I'll take the Amtrack to Chicago and the train to the hotel. We're planning on coming back next spring with a couple more friends and staying here - we really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BizTravellers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple times. The Hotel Indigo Chain is a fantastic idea by Intercontinental Hotels (Holiday Inn) to provide a line fun/casual botique hotels in downtown locations. This hotel is in a fantastic location surrounded by ultra high end Chicago Brownstones. The Hotel Indigo is still a somewhat new chain and they are trying to find the balance between a full service and a casual hotel experience. The room service is so-so. Meals are delivered in disposable packaging which is a strange decision considering most companies are trying to go "green". Don't be afraid to raise any concerns to the Managers, Intercontinental is trying to make this chain succeed and any/all feedback is good for them to hear. My favorite part about this chain is that the rooms are all unique in a modern theme and they ALWAYS use wood type floors instead of carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: rclib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Indigo for the first time this past April. The hotel was extremely comfortable. Loved the decor and how neither of our rooms felt like cookie cutter room. They even brought use a fridge, which was not standard. Our biggest concerns was the shower curtain was moldy at the bottom. I would hope they could exchange this for a clean one. The rug in our room was ripped and torn looking. My other concern was when we tried to exchange some change for dollar bills at the front desk the clerk treated my nieces like she was put out. So i had to go and exchange our coins. Although the only reason why we needed dollar bills was because there pop machines change slot was broke and would only accept our dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!! Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janabelle3
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hotel Indigo downtown Chicago and had a very pleasant experience! The bed was SUPER comfortable, the staff were all very friendly and accomodating, and the decor of the hotel was very refreshing and beachy. Very cute! I must say, the water pressure in the shower was great too! Only little things are I was unable to close a drape in the room to block out the sun and get privacy-there was only a sheer piece of fabric there and a decorational curtain that wouldn't go down. So that was a tad annoying- and I wish there was a rug also right next to the bed since there are hardwood floors. There was just one at the end of the bed. Also-the hotel is a tad off the beaten path but definitely on a quiet street where I could hear the birds chirping outside which was nice. All in all though-the room was great and a wonderful price- would stay again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: lookinforsun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two girls (13,16) stayed here for one night. We stayed in room 1415. It was the quietest hotel room I've ever stayed in. The location is excellent. It's in a residential area so it's quiet. There is a nice cafe just a few doors down for breakfast or a Starbuck's on the corner. We walked to Oak Street Beach, Rush Street, Michigan Ave and just strolled around the neighborhood. The girls loved shopping on Oak Street and then took a cab to State Street for more shopping. The staff was very friendly and very knowledgeable about the area. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place...Beautiful People...Beautiful Stay”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a one day conference and I found the amazing place. The hotel is well decorated and definately had their "theme" but all in all it was very relaxing and very comfortable. It is exactly what you expect and then some from a chain hotel. The staff is great. The found theatre tickets and reccomended amazing places to eat. Being from Chicago originally I wanted to know some new things I may not have been to...and they sent me to some great places I would not have ever thought to go to. I might add that my co workers loved the reccomendations and I was a hit at the meeting the next day. Its a super fantastic chain hotel that I would strongly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “I have never ever been treated so well or felt so unique!”
Reviews.Author: GrÃ¡inneM
Reviews.Content: It's taken me ages to write this review...for no good reason other than a tendency to get distracted! I stayed in this hotel in December while I was attending the RSNA conference. Each year thousands of radiologists descend on Chicago and take over most of the hotel beds making it a very busy time for everyone. I was placed in Hotel Indigo but the organisers and was a little concerned after reading the previous reviews. I e-mailed the hotel before I arrived to request a fridge (thanks to tips from previous reviewers) and was pleasantly surprised by the quick and friendly response from the manager, SeÃ¡n. On arrival I was met by a friendly doorman who carried my bags inside. Check-in was effortless (and sweet thanks to the candy bowl) and I was given a room on the 12th floor. Reception was small but welcoming-a very laid-back, beachy feeling in snowy Chicago! My room was small, but I was on my own so that wasn't a huge issue. No fridge so I rang down and had one in my room in under 5 minutes. Everything in the room was completely spotless. Big TV with cable channels, free WiFi and a coffee maker. Alarm clock is a nice touch. The bathroom was small but immaculately clean and stocked with Aveda products. Bed was sooo comfy. Slept like a log each night. Breakfast wasn't included in my room rate and I just had my own anyway but there were very affordable options in the little restaurant downstairs. I did avail of their Starbucks coffee and loved the staff there. I only got coffee maybe 4 times but the staff were so friendly and remembered me. It was lovely! The onsite gym is open all day and accessible by keycard. It's small with 2 treadmills, bike, elliptical, stepper, weight machines and free weights. The equipment is in good order however and they have pretty much everything you could want-including kettlebells, Bosus and extensive free weights. Loved it! Potential temptation lay in the snack machines just outside the door ;-) Didn't use the hairdressers or spa but it looked clean and friendly. There was also a business centre downstairs with 2 computers and printing facilities. Very handy for online flight check-in! I was allowed to get a package delivered to the hotel which was extremely handy. I was also completely overwhelmed by the helpful attitude of one of the reception staff. I have unfortunately forgotten her name, but believe she was from the Czech republic. She went above and beyond the call of duty to help my fax details when I was trying to order a digital camera and helped me with problems with the order. When I was leaving she gave me a photo album to use with the new camera. Apparently the hotel has a little fund for such little gifts. I have never ever been treated so well or had such a good experience and I have stayed in many hotels and guesthouses. I was upset leaving because everyone was so sweet from the doormen to reception to the guy on the early coffee shift... Location is great, only a few minutes from Michigan Avenue and within a few blocks of Whole Foods and a Dominick's. Starbucks and Walgreens are on the corner and the Ambassador East hotel is on the next block. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. It is exactly what I'd want from a boutique hotel-cosy, quirky, homely...and above all, outstanding and personal customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: RedStateRyan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 4 other friends. Yes five us us to one room. Going into this experience I thought it was going to be hell, 5 people to one room! As it turned out it was actually really great. We had two double beds in our room and a cot. The bed I slept in was really comfortable. I loved the linens they used. Nice, crisp and comfortable. I really liked the decor. I know it's not everyone's taste but I do like more a modern theme. The television was a normal size and not a flat screen which I thought was weird given the nice modern theme. I have to say my favorite part about this room was the bathroom. I really like how it was designed with kind of like an open shower. It did not have a bath tub just the shower, which was fine with me. And finally it had free wifi! Which, being a tech professional I really appreciate! I hate when hotels want to charge for internet access. So overall great experience. I did think it was kind of pricy but given it's location in Chicago, you'll have that.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: winter-schminter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked using rewards points. However, it was expressed by the person I travelled with that the amount of points it cost seemed a bit excessive, but it was a Friday night and a very last minute booking. We were just grateful for a nice (and very clean) place to stay. Upon arrival we were standing 2nd in line for check in. The person at the desk called for help and we were quickly attended to. Within 5 minutes we arrived at our room. The crisp blue themed decor was very nice (though not my personal taste) and the amenities were ample. This theme was carried out through the hotel and was a nice visual change to the normal beige scene. The room size was above average, however, the set up for the king room was slightly odd. The tv was a traditional 32 inch and the bed was on the far side of the room. Even with my glasses, I sometimes had a difficult time making everything out. The bathroom was large, the Aveda bath products were appreciated, and the linens were very nice for a hotel. The bed itself was well appointed with very nice linens. My only complaint was the heating/cooling system. No matter how much we messed with it, the room was either freezing or steamy. Even when it was turned off, it kicked on periodically and was extremely loud (to the point of needing to adjust the tv volume). There was a thermostat on the wall, but it was disconnected and we could not get it to work. Unfortunately, the temperature issue turned an above average stay into just average.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, bright, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lobsterroll704
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights at this very pretty hotel. The weather was awful---2 degrees with strong winds--so we did not hurry out in the morning. I picked up coffee, juice, bagels, and yogurt downstairs, and we watched "Home for the Holidays" on the TV while we stayed in bed. The beds were so comfortable, the room was so bright and did not look like any other hotel room I had stayed in (big indigo prints, with bright coral walls for accents). We had fun.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: boytoy12
Reviews.Content: Short business trip that became extended due to weather delays. But if I was going to get snowed in anywhere - I choose the Indigo Chicago. Staff was very helpful and concerned about me getting home. Hotel was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, and charming!”
Reviews.Author: hawk72rn
Reviews.Content: stayed with family with children. rooms big enough, nice decor, accomodated our request to get 2 rooms together. we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. view was good and location great! clean, clean, clean!! and one of my family members is a germophobe and she even commented on how clean it was! we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A good kind of strange!”
Reviews.Author: damonandtina
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at this quirky, strange and endearing little hotel near the Magnificent Mile and am leaving pleasantly surprised by it. Of course, like any hotel, there are a few downsides: -THIRTY-SIX dollars a day for parking!! A staggering amount for putting your car in a spot for a few hours!! -Rooms are very small. Hard to navigate where you plan on placing things in your room. -In my room (610), the curtains couldn't be raised or lowered, as the cords were tangled in a maze that I tried, but could never figure out how to untangle. Among the many positives of this hotel: -Wonderful, tropical feel that's sunny and happy. --Cool colors and furniture selections in rooms, including a very neat espresso-pod machine in each room for a high-quality cup of coffee. -Aveda products are ALWAYS a plus in any hotel! -Very comfortable bedding! -FREE internet connection was an unexpected plus for a city hotel. In fact, it's downright rare! -Quiet halls, nice clock radios, and functional workout room are nice little toppings to round things out. While I have stayed in a hundred fancier hotels with more amenities, this one is simply an offbeat little treat that breaks the monotony of hotel rooms up for a road warrior like me. Definitely worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Small Service”
Reviews.Author: paceum2
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip through Hotwire for $99, but it was not worth it. Hotwire said 3 and a half stars, but it should have been 2 and a half. Room 1404 - The room was 10x14 feet and it had an overhang, very very small room. The shade was broken, the menu was dirty and again, the room was tiny! We couldn't check in until after 4pm, which meant delaying our plans. Also, parking was $36 and dont try to park on the street overnight b/c you'll get a $60 ticket. Opt for the better 4 star hotel near the magnificent mile. Next time, I am booking 4 stars or better if its on hotwire. NEVER GO BOUTIQUE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice change of pace to stay at an "urban beach house"”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at this hotel - and I've enjoyed it both times! It's really hard to believe this place is related to Holiday Inn!! LOCATION- Awesome. In the fairly quiet section of Gold Coast. Plenty of restaurants, stores, etc, just around the corner. The Red line subway is very close as well. In a very walkable area!!! SERVICE- I agree with a couple other reviews. The staff can be slightly aloof, but for the most part nice and helpful. But that's really what you would expect from a boutique-type property, right? ROOMS- Unique. Pretty hard to describe the vibe if you haven't been there. It feels sort of like an urban beach house with a whimsical edge. Different than any hotel you have stayed with before, trust me!!! I like it. Tiny rooms (think NYC), but some unexpected touches. The bathrooms and cool (a bit minimalistic) with a stand-up shower. Great bedding and pillows! NOISE- It was out of hand this time. I was at the end of the hallway (room 913) and the noise from the maids was awful. Woke me up before 0700 and it never really stopped. I blasted the A/C for some white noise and was able to get a little more sleep. You might want to request a room AWAY from the maid closet!!! GYM- Very nice for such a small property. Pretty much anything you might need, although it's a LITTLE outdated. Hard to complain though - most boutique hotels don't have any gym. You really should try this place. It's not for everyone. However, it's nice to steer away from predictable hotel rooms for a change!! FYI-They have larger rooms available in case you have a larger group or family. I actually think this would be a good place to stay with kids, too!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseIllinois
Reviews.Content: I read a review that said be careful - I should have listened. Its average in terms of ammenities -short on service -for example: I arrived and had a business colleague with me who decided to join me at the last minute. I had a reservation -he did not. I checked in -no problem -he asks about availability, front desk says "yes" -so he tries to take the next step - get a room & check in " I'm sorry -you have to call -we cannot book you here at the front desk -only reservations can do that" -we take the phone number -call it -it rings in the back -we are literally standing in the lobby talking to someone 50 ft away from the front desk who now tells us " yes we have rooms -but a 2 night minimum." Go figure -here we are, unable to get a room when they are available -and a very uncooperative front desk who just shrugs at us...so he goes down to Embassy suites -gets a bigger room and lower rate!! If Holiday Inns wants to make a go of this new brand -they have ALOT of work to do - I'll never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Come back for more”
Reviews.Author: homosassagrl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Indigo before. Great location, great staff. My sister stayed there too, and just loved it! Great farmer's market on Saturday down the street, right across from Starbucks and Walgreens. Some upkeep could be done to the hotel, but we just love its funkiness and charm. Very accommodating for handicap/assistance. We keep coming back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Baja500
Reviews.Content: My husband was taking a training at the hotel, so we opted to stay on-site. I believe he paid about $139 a night but I'm not sure. The hotel is in an excellent location in the Gold Coast area. The El-train red line is a 2 minute walk away, the walk to the "Magnificant Mile" is about 15 minutes, and to the loop is about 20-25 minutes. The Oak Street beach is about 5-10 minutes away on foot as well. Our room was two double-beds - a little on the small side so may not be suitable to those with small families. However, for us, we didn't need more room. Rooms do not have mini-fridges, however, the hotel has 3-4 that you can request to use. We got the last one available and called a couple weeks before to reserve it - if you need / want a fridge make sure to request it early. The shampoo/conditioner/soap are all Aveda products which is very nice, rooms were kept very clean and the decor is bright and pleasant. Beds were comfortable. Front desk staff were helpful when needed. There is a great brunch spot two doors down called "Third Coast" on the corner of Dearborn and Goeth.

Reviews.Title: “Miinor problem exacerbated”
Reviews.Author: purcfin
Reviews.Content: As past visitors on multiple occasions to Hotel Indigo, we have generally been satisfied with our experience. With every visit we request a minor convenience that we know cannot be assured, but has been provided without a problem on previous stays. We were somewhat concerned about an understaffed front desk upon check-in, and that was a predictor of our problem the remainder of the day. Our aforementioned convenience was forthcoming soon, we were told, but it took the staff several hours to finally inform us they could not accomodate us till much later in the day. Calls to housekeeping and management went unanswered. More timely communication would have allowed our schedule for the rest of the day to be less uncertain. As Janie hinted in an earlier review, the staff attitude at Hotel Indigo seemed markedly more aloof and disinterested this trip. A hip, casual attitude is not necessarily conducive to satisfied guests. On the positive side, we were able to check in late in the morning which was appreciated. But, over the past couple years we have noticed wear and tear rapidly overtaking the property. Too bad--the location is perfect for our purposes, but we will be exploring other options for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small boutique feel”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveller30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few nights and was very impressed. It is located in a beautiful tree lined street just minutes walk to everything. The rooms were unlike anything I have ever seen before. Decorated like a beach house. Very modern, funky and fresh. The bed was comfortable and amenities were great. Free internet was also a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “Indigo doesn't measure up to its own aspirations”
Reviews.Author: janie99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in late July for 4 nights. This was our third stay at H. I., and it will be our last. There was no dramatic bad experience, but for $250 a night, it doesn't measure up. Indigo has a contract with one of the airlines to house their overseas flight crews. The airline crews get to check out of the hotel after 5 pm, which means that the hotel has a shortage of rooms for people checking in. The email that I received from the hotel a couple of days before our stay had a cheery message, "Your room is ready!" The email stated that check-in time was 3 pm. We arrived at 3:40 and were told that check-in was at 4 pm and that our room was not ready. We walked over to the Starbuck's and hung out for an hour and our room still wasn't ready. We finally checked in after 5 pm. And this is not the first time this happened. There has been a check-in delay each time in the last three years that we stayed at the Indigo. I wrote a (very polite) email to the manager to point out that this was a problem, and he never responded to my email. The location is great, but once you've stayed at the Hotel Indigo, the decor isn't enough to overcome the downsides: very small rooms, lackluster management, long waits to check in. And the furniture & bright wall paper is starting to to look a little worn. Anyway, I'm tired of being disappointed with the Indigo. We'll probably stay at the Intercontinental on Michigan Ave next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very tropical”
Reviews.Author: sigs99
Reviews.Content: We paid $137 total on Hotwire which was a very fair price for the stay. When we first walked in it reminds you of a tropical resort somewhere in the Bahamas. It has a very relaxing feel...not all rushed and business like. We stayed on the 14th floor which offered a great view of Chicago. The bedroom area had plenty of space as well as drawer space. It had a good sized TV. The living area was small, but had an oversized closet. It had a table and a sitting chair. The bathroom was very small. My wife liked having the mirror and sink outside of the bathroom so she could get ready while I showered. She also liked the detachable shower head. I had no issues with the staff. They were always friendly and gave us some good advice about the area. The red line subway is less than 2 blocks away. It made it easy to get to Michigan Ave. and to China town. There were plenty of pubs about a block away. The area outside of the hotel is residential so it was always quite outside. The only downside is that the ice machine and pop machines are on the second floor only. One elevator was out of order so coming and leaving in the morning was a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Disorganized”
Reviews.Author: ahazan
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through Hotwire. We got a great deal at $129.00 a night! That's where the deal ended.... The people working at the front desk looked as if they were upset we had disturbed them when all three rooms in my party showed up at the same time. Only one room was ready so we all had to squeeze into one room for the time being - boy did we have to squeeze! The room barely left a path around the oversized bed. There were no drawers so we were forced to leave our suitcases on the ground open, leaving even less space. When my group returned from our evening, the rest of the party were given there rooms....let's just say that one of the rooms was already occupied when they arrived. How does something like that happen! We woke up in the morning to go down for the free breakfast we were given because of the "mix-up" but it wasn't much of a deal after waitng in line for half an hour watching the girl behind the counter funmble around as if she had never heard of coffee. When we finally left Hotel Indigo no one said goodbye, wished us a safe journey home or even asked how we enjoyed our stay. Overall if you are looking for a clean hotel, that it is. If you are looking for a place to compliment such a beautiful and freindly city, you are better off booking another hotel. I won't use hotwire again to book in case I end up at Hotel Indigo again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TalesFromTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here at the end of June while attending a conference. Very attractive hotel- converted older hotel so rooms vary in size, but very nicely done. Staff friendly and very nice feel to the hotel. Very good location a couple of blocks from CTA transit line- several good restaurants nearby. Recommend it Had read a TripAdvisor report that gave me pause, but discount it after my very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the Indigo”
Reviews.Author: OHVirginiaNative
Reviews.Content: The hotel, located in the relatively quiet residential area of the Gold Coast, is conveniently located 1 1/2 blocks from a subway stop. The only issue with transportation is that we could not return northbound due to weekend and evening construction closing the route. The room design really made fantastic use of the space. Having a small sitting area added to the value. When we first arrived, there was drilling right outside as workers repaired the scaffolding -- the hours were limited to midday, and we didn't have any problems with noise. We really enjoyed our stay, and there were only two minor drawbacks -- the food service was lackadaisical, at best, and the front desk insisted on a limousine service to the airport, when we were able to hail a taxi that morning for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Indigo Chicago Gold Coast is an excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sjmpassa
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The check in staff were ready for us, the rooms were clean and had a fantastic view of Lake MIchigan. The front desk staff were extremely helpful as were the bellhops when we were looking for information and directions. Very comfortable beds and all the amenities you could want. Definitely a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Indigo”
Reviews.Author: mayba
Reviews.Content: We had to come to Chicago for a funeral. We only stayed one night. The Hotel Indigo was beautiful. The color schemes were awesome. The staff was friendly. The night clerk upgraded our room for us. I LOVED the location. Quiet residential area, but just a couple blocks from all the action. We were able to walk the tree lined beautiful streets to the church for the funeral. There is a GREAT restaurant on the same block, wonderful breakfast. It couldn't have been a better experience. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theresalpbc
Reviews.Content: My Aunt, cousin and I came to the Big City from Louisiana to do all the shopping we could. Friends had told us about the Indigo (without going into great detail so as not to spoil our surprise). We checked in and were absolutely amazed at how different it was but we still felt as if we were on a relaxing vacation. I loved the decor - thought it was very cool. That was enough to have enjoyed the hotel but we also experienced staff that always smiled and were very helpful to some southern girls. I've told everyone about our stay. Everyone going to Chicago for a visit or some shopping should get to stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: leahmarie
Reviews.Content: First off I am a total lover of the Hyatt Brand but decided to stay here for work and the decor and venture out of my comfort zone. I also travel a lot of work and leisure so believe I am a bit more tough than most. Check In: Your first impression is check in and they get a big F. I had to change my flight to an early flight and got to the hotel at around 11:30am. I absolutely knew check-in was many hours later and had no problem waiting if they did not have a room. There was one middle aged guy at the front desk who helped me check-in. He stared at the computer for a good 10 minutes before he told me they had no rooms available. I asked if he could let me know when they did and he just nodded. He was in no way friendly, personable or even acted like he cared about his job. He felt the need to remind me at least half a dozen times check in was not until 4, ok, I get it. Nearly 30 minutes later another couple checked in and there room was not ready. He said if they wanted to upgrade they could for xxx a night and get a King Room. I was pretty livid as that is exactly what my room was. Nearly 2 hours later I asked if there was a room yet and he said, "yeah, it's been ready for almost an hour and a half" Room: They do a good job of making them appear bigger online however they are in no way unlivable or uncomfortable. They placement of furniture (and amount of it) is a little odd. Note: the chair in the middle of the floor? Bed is a king and very comfortable although the little pillows are rather crappy. The decor is great and bright and I loved it. I have read some complaints on the bathroom and had no problems there. Amenities: The cable is pretty bad, no channels at all. There are either news or Chicago tourism channels. The internet is free but the connection is so-so most of the time. Better than paying though so they get a huge plus for that. Also Aveda products in the bathroom, my favorite! I drank the $2.50 water in your room left to tease you but ah well. The coke machine does has .50 cokes though! The breakfast was good but VERY expensive. I had $4.00 for a small OJ! That is just ridiculous no matter what hotel you stay at. I am waiting to eat right now until I get to the airport! Never had dinner there, again so pricey for hotel food that doesn't even have an actual restaurant! Never tried the bar either but they didn't have a good beer selection, otherwise I would have. Close to the hotel is a great little cafe right to the left. It's excellent, try the tuna melt, YUM. Also to the right is Edwardos which was also good. Right on the corner is a Walgreens and another block away you have Costco and Jewel. There is a Subway, Jimmy Johns, Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts also right within 2 blocks. Overall, it was a good stay. I was on business so I worked nearly all day and everyday so didn't have much time to do anything else. I would stay again but for equal prices you could get more amenities( breakfast, friendlier morning staff and a more central location) It was right next to the subway though that will take you down to the loop so that is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: sgsilva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Indigo for 6 nights for a restaurant convention. I booked there based on this site and guidebook reviews. I was in room 812. The hotel has a excellent location on a quiet upscale residential street yet very close to nightlife and the subway. The breakfast restaurant and the bar are very nice. The decor is also interesting and pleasing. My room was tiny. I normally don't unpack my suitcase when travelling but just leave it open on the stand. I couldn't do this here as that took up 80% of the open floor space. It would be impossible for me to have my suitcase out and also pull out the ironing board. There was a large tray with glasses on the bed when I checked in. It looked nice, but it was too big to put on the small desk. The only place to put it was under the bed with my suitcase. I asked after I checked in if a larger room was available but was told that the hotel was sold-out and the only option was to upgrade to a suite for $600+ a night. I thought that I could maybe adjust as I wouldn't be in my room that much. The curtain was broken and could not be raised. Despite every effort, the beautiful shower completely flooded the bathroom every time. A flawed design I guess. For the first 3 nights only one elevator was working. Therefore when coming or going to the room I was almost always in a crowded elevator that stopped at every floor. Housekeeping also left something to be desired.
