I worked in the hotel industry for many years and always tip the maid heavily as they are generally the hardest working and lowest paid employees of the hotel. Despite this, I was NEVER replenished with soap or shampoo during my 6 night stay. When on day 3, after leaving the maid $5 each day, she just put the empty shampoo bottle back on the shelf, no more tips from me. I called housekeeping asking for more shampoo and got a voicemail. Luckily I had some shampoo of my own. Three days later and no one responeded to my voicemail, no more shampoo for me. Lastly, on the final night I stayed in and watched a movie. During the movie I saw a HUGE bug crawling up the wall which I promptly killed. After day 2 I started to call around to change hotels. Unfortunately it was a big convention weekend and everyone was either full or charging their highest rates, I toughed it out. But at the time of booking there was many other hotels for close to the same rate that were certainly not dumps like this. I have always trusted tripadvisor to help me find hotels in a new city. This is the first time that I was really let down. This hotel sucks! I will never stay here again. I hope that this helps others.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: countrycat
Reviews.Content: After spending the week before the Iowa caucuses slogging through snow and going door to door in 7 degree weather, then retiring at night to our run-down $70 B&B room, walking into the Hotel Indigo was like making it to heaven! From the minute you walk into the lobby, you feel transported to a quiet, tropical island where all the inhabitants exist only to pamper you. The lobby even SMELLS wonderful! Even though we arrived hours ahead of check-in time, the desk clerk was happy to give us a room - which was an oasis after where we'd been staying in Iowa! We had only been in the room about 15 minutes when the desk called to make sure everything was satisfactory. Although the room was small, it was find for my 13-yr-old daughter and me. She lounged on one of the incredibly comfortable beds watching the large TV while I sat in the small sitting area with my laptop. We weren't tripping over each other and didn't miss the lack of room service. There are plenty of restaurants close by that deliver, so we had lunch set up. And again, the desk called to tell us the food was on the way up. A nice alert and safety precaution. The subway is just about 2 blocks & it takes you right downtown. The neighborhood is quiet and safe. There's a drug store and grocery story a block from the hotel. We went to Second City that night and it was an easy 15 minute walk. Again, no safety issues, just a nice stroll in the city. I think the best part about the Indigo is the attention they pay to the "little things." 1. The drinks in the Coke machine were only 50 cents. Most hotels stick you for a dollar or more. That's not a big deal, but it's nice not to be gouged. 2. Everything was squeaky clean and looked brand new. The hair dryer was a real dryer - not one of the half-working models stuck on the wall. 3. Everyone was smiling and anxious to be helpful. They arranged our ride to the airport, gave directions, etc. We never felt like we were a nuisance or treated like we were stupid. 4. The hotel was QUIET and so was the neighborhood. We got an AARP rate for $124/night - which was incredibly low for the experience we had. Truthfully, I wanted to move in for a few days. Can't wait to try some Hotel Indigos in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Locorico
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great price! We only stayed one night but found the Indigo to be chic, priced right and in a great location! Only a few blocks from the (red line) subway station @ Clark & Division and right in the heart of the action at Rush/Division, etc. etc.. Highly receommended.

Reviews.Title: “IndiSTOP: Gold Bust. Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo Gold Coast is a weak attempt at a boutique hotel, since at core it has budge underpinnings. Elevators are slow and one is often sharing them with cleaning staff. Room was quiet but bright color scheme is annoying. No desk was available, causing one to use a table that was unfit for laptop use. No room service available in between lunch and dinner. Bathroom had only a small shower and smelled of mold (including mold spots on ceiling). Wireless printing service does not work as advertised. And to top it all off, front desk staff at 5am had to be AWAKENED in order to move from the couch (where he had been sleeping) to process my checkout. Overall, an awful experience and a horrible way to spend $400 for a poor one-night stay. STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to start a holiday”
Reviews.Author: WakeyEngland
Reviews.Content: After an eight hour flight from London it was nice to be greeted by a cheerful and efficient member of staff. This was our first stop on a 2800 mile road trip and it was nice to kick off the trip by staying in this unusual hotel. The hotel decoration is bright throughout which gives the impression of plenty of space. The furniture is designed perfectly to add to the decor. Our room although not small was an unusual shape which made a change from the rectangular boxes offerd by the larger chain hotels. It was clean and well maintained. The advantages of the hotel are, that it is situated on the edge of the main districts of Chicago. About three blocks from the shore of Lake Michigan and about a quarter mile away from some good restaurants on State Street. We walked back from the Wrigley Building in just over an hour and this included stops for window shopping. The John Hancock Tower is no more than a fifteen minute walk. If you do not feel like walking there is a CTA station on the corner of the next block with services downtown. It offers restaurant and bar services, the breakfast whilst adequate was a little on the expensive side, although nothing compared to New York prices. Disadvantages. The hotel could do with some double glazing because although it is tucked away in a nice suburb the general city noise from the main streets can be heard. Also if like us your room is situated near the elevator these have an annoying habit of ringing a bell everytime they pass your floor. In general though I would recommend this boutique style hotel to anyone wishing to spend some time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and lovely”
Reviews.Author: NYorkers
Reviews.Content: The Indigo is a really sweet little place, very boutique-y and very clean. I loved the blueberry wallpaper! The rooms are painted in bright colors and the whole ambiance is refreshing. Nice little touches like a modern coffeemaker and a sitting room made this place a great experience. Location is perfect. Service was great, too. Just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern and Central”
Reviews.Author: dc_irl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located - the decor is the room was very modern and clean. Although the room and bathroom is small, the decor more than makes up for it. The breakfast downstairs had a very limited menu so you might find you will have to go elsewhere for breakfast. Overall a very nice hotel that I would probably stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: m0traveler
Reviews.Content: Was here on a girls weekend and loved the property. It is so refreshing to stay somewhere that is different. The location was great. Staff was very helpful in making dinner reservations for us and went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. We had large corner rooms on the 8th floor and could see the lake from one of those rooms. I would have preferred to have also had a tub, but the shower was nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially for a quick weekend getaway. I will definately stay here again when I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and darling rooms”
Reviews.Author: molliemoleo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is REALLY cute and unique. The location is great - even for a group of girls that included one on crutches. We never had an issue getting a cab and it was close to pretty much everything we wanted to see. Definitely take the train in from the airport (especially Midway). It was easy and only $2. Downfalls - I ordered a rollaway bed when I booked the room months in advance of our stay. I also called a month before we arrived to confirm it AND called the day of to confirm it would be in our room. No such luck. After making a pretty big deal out of it, they delivered one the next day. Thanks to a great staff - it wasn't their fault and they handled my frustration really well. ALSO - we ordered a few snacks from room service. We ordered the "warm bleu cheese dip and salsa" only to get warm Tostitas cheese dip. It was seriously like they just opened the jar and microwaved it - delicious...but worth $9? Nope. Just a little bizarre that they OBVIOUSLY brought us the wrong thing and acted like nothing happened. BUT, all in all, it was a great trip. We had a 2 Queen room and it was big and clean with comfy beds and plenty of space for all of our stuff...which was a lot. I would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel- Good Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: FLA_expat
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo was a pleasant surprise. We stayed for two nights on award points (so no thoughts on value/price). Even though we had an interior room on the 12th floor (one large window looked out to the building's air shaft) the room felt cozy, not cave-like. There is not a lot of extra space for luggage (one large suitcase and a garmet bag was plenty), so if you travel with a lot of bags you might want to look elsewhere. Nice Aveda soaps in the bathroom. The lobby snack bar/restaurant had good food, although it was overpriced ($9 for a plate of hummus). Easy 2-block walk to the subway. Overall, a nice choice!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, disorganized front desk, questionable value”
Reviews.Author: stlmann
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and while location is excellent, there are a few issues concerning the hotel to be aware of: 1. Rooms are very small. No room to put more than one suitcase in the room. We were stepping over ours. 2. While mattress comfortable, why use the cheap sheet around a thin blanket that Motel 8's use. For upscale, use proper duvet or better linens. 3. Check in was a slow and disorganized. I booked a king bed but when we went to the room, it was a queen. When I went back to the front desk, they said they made a mistake but I doubt it. There were many people waiting for a room so I think they had some unspoken problems that day. 4. At $300/night, I thought it was expensive but maybe there are better rates. Staff at the hotel was very nice including bellhop and room attendants.

Reviews.Title: “Could NOT have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_WashDC
Reviews.Content: I'm a Chicago native (tho' moved away in '96) and went "home" for a weekend with my husband to visit friends. This hotel was perfect. The location was great... basically @ Dearborn and Division. We took the CTA for $2/each from Midway airport to the hotel. Went smoothly except for a few flights of stairs with luggage. If you're a bit adventurous, the CTA's definitely a value! The hotel's style reminded me of an upscale hotel that you'd find in a European city... rooms are small, but the decorating was "edgy" in a very cool way. Granite counter tops in the bathrooms, Pergo flooring in the room with an area rug, one wall was covered with HUGE blueberry wallpaper. (Yes, like someone took a photo of a basket of just-washed blueberries, and blew it up into a wall-sized photograph!) Linens and bedding were pristine. Room was very clean. Only drawback was that room was located directly across from the elevator and we could hear folks chattin' while waiting and the "ding" when the elevator arrived. Staff was friendly and helpful, phone system was easy to use (voice mail & wake up calls). We did not eat there. (Hotel has a limited breakfast menu, but what they had looked appetizing and the seating area looked clean and, again, had that cool decorating thing goin' on.) Had breakfast a few doors down at 3rd Coast Cafe--also highly recommend; the selection there is more of a bacon & eggs, bigger breakfast type thing. "Mother's" (a fairly well-known bar) was around the corner. Lots of fun... sang 'til 2:30am with the rest of the folks at the bar. Crowd was about 20 years younger than we were, but they didn't seemed bothered by us old folks (we're in our forties). The wait staff there was pleasant, even at that hour, and since Mother's had only popcorn to eat, our waitress suggested we run across the street, pick up a pizza and bring it back in! We had a ball...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Dreid
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July whilst in town to attend a wedding. The decor in the hotel is beautiful - a calm and quiet escape from the searing July temperatures. Staff were friendly and room very inviting. We had roow 711 which was huge! A massive bed and a comfortable chair and then a seperate area which gave plenty of room for suitcases. Room only had a shower and no bath but it was a large wet room shower with complimentary Aveda products, a hairdryer and plenty of well lit mirrors. Room also provided a safe and an iron and ironing board. Hotel has a coffee bar which sells Starbucks and a variety of freshly prepared breakfast items. It also has a small bar. In terms of location it is in a quiet street in the gold coast surrounded by beautiful brownstones. Just a minute or so walk away are restaurants, bars and a Walgreens for stocking up on supplies. The Lake and Michigan Avenue are about 10 mins walk away. We will definetly stay there again on our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Reisefuedli
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights, great location! Great boutique hotel! Great staff. Had a beautiful room on the top floor (14th floor) with views of Lake Michigan. The room is very cosy with the Indigo colors in light green and light blue. Indigo boutique brand concept is great with Starbucks coffee in the morning. Huge Walgreens located next to the hotel and plenty of great restaurants and shops. Great value for money, would stay again immediately.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Chicago hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Blaize76
Reviews.Content: Whimsical lobby and room design, comfortable rooms with lots of space, great location and exceptional attention to detail. If you need a funky and comfortable place to stay in Chicago I would TOTALLY suggest this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hjepobst
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Chicago was great! On the recommendation of a friend, me and 3 girlfriends stayed here for a girls weekend trip of baseball and shopping and I can honestly say this place is well worth the location and the money. It's only 2 blocks from an El station and located near many fabulous restaurants. The rooms were very clean and the decorations are very unique and lively....a step up from some of your traditional hotels. The staff was very friendly and helpful in helping us get around Chicago through the use of public transportation. My only drawback was the showerhead....could've been a little bigger, but other than that....I have no complients about this hotel and strongly urge everyone to stay at the Hotel Indigo whenever they visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel to trains, Rush Street”
Reviews.Author: gopher_2006
Reviews.Content: I was on a group trip last spring for a couple of days and stayed at this hotel. It was a very nice place to stay. The feel of the hotel is different from any other place I have stayed. It is brightly-colored in the lobby and in the rooms. The location can't be beat--Gold Coast area in Chicago--very close to the El and to Rush Street nightlife. The lobby has a Starbucks and a bar in the front; the bar was pretty well-filled that night, and the Starbucks was the next day. The room I stayed in was large and was well-designed. Beds were comfortable. I would stay here again, the next time I travel to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Great Location for us”
Reviews.Author: Yetiman420
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed compliments of my Holiday Inn points the evening of Friday April 13 and Saturday April 14 2007. We stayed in room 1108. This was the 11th floor out of 14 and faced downtown Chicago to the south (very nice view). The biggest positive to us was the location. To get to the red line of the "L" you need to go one block south and one block west - about 5 minutes. The L train is an excellent way to get around the city. It's two stops away from the Mag mile. We were in town for a Reds vs. Cubs baseball game and the red line takes you right to the stadium. The other positive of the location is being in the Gold Coast neighborhood which is the most exclusive neighborhood in Chicago. The blocks north and to the east (towards the lake) make a nice little walk to check out some really neat, old houses (millions of dollars if you have the means). I've stayed in Chicago a number of times. While the larger chain hotels by the loop are closer to the shopping and tourist stuff, this was the first time I felt immersed as part of the city as opposed to a visitor. The room and hotel have a nautical feel. It was our first stay at the Indigo brand. I've stayed a ton of Holiday Inn's and US hotels. This did feel like the nice version of a Holiday Inn express. Everthing was nice, but it didn't have the quality feel of a Marriott or Hilton. Again, it was nice but the colors and theme just weren't our thing. Not a problem as we were there just to sleep. The drawbacks 1. The friendliness level of the front desk could use some improvement. Nobody asked how my stay was which I think is a minimum for the front desk. They were also complaining to each other about people trying to check in early. 2. The single window in our room did not shut completely and we could hear all of the noise from the street below. I didn't let this impact my rating becuase a) it was room specific and b) it's the city, there's going to be noise. 3. THE VALET PARKING NEXT DOOR WAS $35 A NIGHT. My two free nights cost me $70 in parking!!! I know the city is expensive and it didn't bother me too much at first. When were were strolling the neighborhood, we found a parking lot north of the hotel for $18 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “It's True, I Love the Blue”
Reviews.Author: IndyMegan
Reviews.Content: We chose Indigo because we'd wanted to stay at an Indigo, knowing it's a visual delight. And then we fell in love with (nearly) everything about it. The location is really wonderful - a leafy neighborhood with several restaurants and shops, near a subway line, near a bus line, near the lake and Oak Stree Beach, and a short walk to the heart of downtown. We went with 3 kids, and none of them complained about the walk. Papa Milano's restaurant has long been our traditional stop in Chicago, and what luck - this hotel is just 4 blocks from it. Rooms are decendly spacious, I think more spacious than average. I'm very picky about noise, and we didn't have any problems. Rooms by the elevator might hear more noise. Decor is casual chic. Beds comfortable. The hotel's small size was perfect. The kids could run downstairs to the (free) Internet while we were within earshot in the cafe. We loved our weekend so much that we went back spontaneously a month later, with the kids again. Same experience - except the photo murals in the lobby had been changed to reflect the change of season! I highly recommend this place if you don't need deluxe hotel amenities like four-star dining and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: frqnt_trvlrSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about the location of this hotel as it is a little off the beaten path, but this turned out to be one of the things I liked the most about it. The hotel has a very fun beachy theme. The rooms are a tad small, but for two people, perfectly fine. We had a queen bed room. Apparently the corner rooms are bigger. However, since this was a reward nights trip, I was not going to ask for more. We arrived into Chicago very early and headed to the hotel on the CTA trains from Midway. I was delighted to find that they were willing to let us check in at 11:00 AM as the room was ready. The hotel was very easy to get to using the orange and red lines. The red line which will take you anywhere in the city you would want to go was about a block and a half away from the hotel. My husband and I used the red line late into the night and I never felt unsafe walking back to the hotel. The hotel is very close to lots of restaurants and bars on Rush Street as well as not too far from the Mag. Mile. THIS WAS A GREAT LOCATION! The only bad thing would be that there was only one elevator in service and a rule that only four people could be on at a time. THis was a tad incovenient and we did use the stairs but we were on the 8th floor so it was a little hike. Also, the staff was a touch unfriendly. However, I did all of my planning beforehand so we didn't really need them for much. If you want a staff that will bend over backward for you this is probably not the best choice. Edwardo's Pizza right next store is a great cozy restaurant as well and with Walgreens right down the street you can go and pick up anything you may have forgotton. One last note on the hotel, I appreciated how clean it was. The rooms have wood laminate flooring which added to the charm of the room and did away with awful hotel carpeting which is always dirty! I would stay here again in a heartbeat and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Cute beach theme”
Reviews.Author: latinboy1976
Reviews.Content: First let me say that before booking your stay at this hotel check to see if there is a lower price on a third party site. If there is sign up for the hotels award program and call the 800 number to let them know you found a cheaper price. Not only will they match the price but LOWER the matched price another 10%! Talk about savings and money in the bank! Now about the hotel! After seeing the pics of the rooms and hotel I had to stay there! My trip was in mid February and didn't want to stay in a stuff hotel. I wanted fun bright colors and a beach theme and that is what I got. I found the room just the right size for two people with a total of 4 pieces of luggage and the beds were soooooo comfy I didn't want to get up in the mornings. The staff was pretty nice too with some good recommendations for some good eats near the hotel. Yes as the person from Berlin commented there was a flood and I too saw a bit of the wall tore up on the 4th floor but I am not picky and understand that things happen and break. As for the cheap decor in the lobby as the person from Berlin talked about well gee it's a beach theme! DUH!!!! If you want fancy then go to the Drake or stay home. I say ignore the negative reviews cause they are just bitter people and stay at the Indigo. For the price and location it is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another average hotel experience in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: reisejunky
Reviews.Content: Although the location is outstanding, there were just enough things wrong with the Hotel Indigo to keep me from rating it above average. I spent a February weekend there with a friend in a double room that we booked on Hotwire. The original room they gave us had only one bed and so we were upgraded to a larger one with a small sitting area and windows looking out onto the cityscape - a fine view of old victorians and vintage high-rises. Had we not gotten the upgrade, however, the first room would have been impossibly small even with two beds. The bathroom in the new room- in particular the toilet 'area' - was still very small. The ceilings in the room hovered just above our heads and the door let in all assortment of sounds from the hallway. There was also a lot of flood damage from burst pipes (wall sections removed) and the smell of mold in a few of the common areas. My friend complainded about the lack of television options (only about ten channels) and our remote control was broken and had to be replaced. Only one person was at the desk downstairs, although she was at least friendly. The 'design' of the hotel is more of a make-over with too many bright colors and cheap furniture in the lobby (wooden 20$ deck chairs with bright paint and cushions). The hotel's saving graces are an excellent location on the Near North Side close to entertainment and shops and interesting views from the rooms. Once again I feel obligated to talk about the great fluctuations in prices of downtown Chicago hotels. This hotel was reasonably priced (under 100$/tax incl.) on Hotwire for the time we were there (with the upgrade), and the rack rate was too high, but nothing compared to the price when Chicago hosts one of its many large trade shows. The prices are more than doubled and sometime tripled at such times. Beware of this when planning a trip to the Windy City. If you have options as to when you travel, check the hotel prices and city event schedules before booking your flight.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: chuckab
Reviews.Content: location, location, location - within walking distance of Michigan Avenue, the Lake, etc. Rooms vary in size from tiny to very comfortable for similar rates. Kitchy room decorations are fun and work. Would certainly stay here for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing week-end stay”
Reviews.Author: Indyguy99
Reviews.Content: Very small bathrooms and room size. You could hear phone conversations taking place in adjoining rooms along with their television. Our room was right across from elevator and it was noisy each time guests exited elevator. Front Desk only had one employee during each visit we made and delays were lengthy. Concierge was excellent in help with obtaining show tickets and planning. Front desk could not break a $100 dollar bill down for change. For the price & service, I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Paddy30
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this super fantastic hotel. It is a small hotel tucked among gorgeous townhouses in a residential area but very close to great shops and restaurants. Our room was on the 14th floor with a view of the lake Michigan through some taller nearby buildings. With 2 queen beds and a small sitting area, the room was nicely sized. The color scheme was bright and cheerful. The staff was helpful and friendly. This will definitely be our choice for lodging whenever we visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “The Gorgeous Indigo”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellerIre
Reviews.Content: what a lovely hotel. stayed here with my boyfriend for 5 nights in december. the room was gorgeous, on the 14th floor (which was really the 13th but they call it the 14th, must be superstition) We had a wonderful view over the city. the room wasnt huge by any account but it was perfect for us. bedding was fresh and looked new, however the bed wasnt very big. bathroom was lovely with a new suite and everything was spotless. clean as a pin. aveda shampoo/conditioner and body lotion was supplied and lovely white towels. hairdryer was powerful enough and there was a nice coffee maker and free paper every morning outside our door. the only thing i can fault the room on was the temperature, it was chilly. however, there is a heater you can blast. so everytime we came back we had to put the heater on to warm the room up. (however, it must be said that it was positively freezing outside) also, one thing that really annoyed me was the phone charges from the room. i called ireland for 5 minutes (1 min to a mobile and 4 to a landline) and it cost $40!!!! couldnt believe it! the room was $169 per night (before tax) and the location was good, on a pretty, safe residential street (gorgeous with all the christmas decorations and lights) and about a ten min walk into the middle of the magnificent mile. station nearby too if you need to go to the loop. we walked everywhere though. also, would highly recommend going to see the chicago bulls play. we got the $55 seats and they were great, the atmosphere was amazing and we had great crack. shopping was subject to a 9% sales tax so we saved our money for our onward trip to new york. however, the water tower plaza and filenes did part us with some cash!!! would try somewhere new if we went back (for the fun of it) but would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. it is fresh, vibrant and very confortable. also, would like to say that we found the people of chicago sooo helpful, whenever we looked lost we were approached by a friendly chicagoan who helped us on our way.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JLM42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as unique and chic as others have mentioned. We were there on a sold out weekend and you never would have known it. The place still felt small and intimate despite the capacity crowd. We didn't eat at the hotel, preferring to walk up the block to the 3rd Coast CafÃ© for late-night snacks and breakfasts. The bar was always hopping and we enjoyed a cocktail there one evening. The neighborhood is wonderfully serene with some amazing old Chicago architectural treasures. It's also incredibly convenient to the El and within walking distance to restaurants and some of the Chicago attractions. Our room was small by U.S. standards, but large if you compare it to hotel rooms in Europe. Bed was very comfy. They've solved the problem of door slamming that an earlier reviewer posted. The doors now are on hydraulic hinges that prevent the slamming. We had a room just down from the elevator and never heard any noise from the hall. Why not five stars? We did hear noise through the connecting door to the next room. So, if you are sensitive to noise you may want to check and see if the room you're assigned is a connecting room. The "view" from our room was of an interior shaft that contained the fire exit stairs. This was okay as we didn't spend much time in the room viewing, but we did feel a little silly when we had to call the front desk to ask if it was raining so we could dress appropriately.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Juggling_Mom
Reviews.Content: This is a trendy, out-of-the ordinary hotel, decorated with bright colors and nice touches. The lobby is quite a showstopper with huge chairs decorated with large pillows. The room I had was on the 12th floor -- it was small but very comfortable. The large bed was spectacularly comfy, with a wonderful poofy comforter and plenty of good quality pillows. The hotel has free WiFi, and it worked very well. The coffee machine was one of the new Melita Pod types, and it produced a fine cup fairly easily. The bathroom was very nice with Aveda toiletries and plenty of good towels. In the renovation, the hotel replaced the bathtub with an extra large tiled shower equipped with a teak bench -- by far the nicest shower I've had in a hotel. So, why not five stars?? First, when I arrived my room was not ready yet. I was there at about 5pm and apparently they were counting on me not showing up until 6ish. I was able to sit and use the WiFi in the lobby, so my time wasn't spent unpleasantly, it just would have been better if my room was ready. Second, in trying to aim the shower head where the water needed to go, the holder broke. The desk told me that this was a problem and the manufacturer had given them replacements; unfortunately it slightly marred an otherwise fabulous shower experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: agoldman3
Reviews.Content: We (wife and 2 kids) stayed at the Hotel Indigo for 3 nights in September, 2006. We were in town for a wedding and this hotel was recommended to us for its location. We found the hotel to be very nice and appreciated its unique qualities. The hardwood floors and bright colors were a great change of pace from anything Holiday Inn has ever done. Most roomd are VERY small. We noticed that our room with 2 queen beds was almost double the size of the other rooms our family had with 1 king-bed. We did not experience the slow elevators or noise that some other reviewers mentioned. This IS a boutique hotel which has narrow hallways and smaller rooms, but it also delivers a unique experience that was a nice change from the average "big" hotel. The location is not too far off Michigan Ave and you are close to Rush St. and State Street. We relied on taxis and never had a problem finding one. The walgreens right on the corner was a great benefit to stock-up on snacks and drinks for the kids and we preferred the cafe nextdoor to the on-site coffee shop for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdin
Reviews.Content: The hotel indigo is situated in a wonderful neighborhood north of downtown. The tree-lined streets and relaxing feel of the area add to the charm. The room was very clean, nicely decorated with hardwood floors and bright colors throughout. The beds were comfy, the air conditioning was very good, and the rooms were well lit. My only complaints would have to do with the size of the room...rather smalll for the 2 queen beds, and the storage space was lacking...barely enough room for two peoples things, but not for suitcases that had to be stacked in the room. One other difficulty was the lack of cabs in the area. One rainy day we waited 70 minutes for pickup. Other days we took a short walk to the Ambassador East to pick up a ride. The staff is great, the bar downstairs is fun and overall is was a great experience. Quite a contrast from our last trip to chicago when we stayed in the icky congress plaza. Great tip...Mario's Italian Restaurant across the street is EXCELLENT. Give it a try or two while staying at the Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicagp”
Reviews.Author: CenterMtraveler
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Indigo. We were there in order to attend a wedding, and this was one of the 2 hotels that provided rooms at a discounted price to the wedding guests. What a terrific choice! Our room was large and tastefully decorated in bright colors. Indigo and orange and green, I know it sounds bizarre, but it all flowed together quite nicely. The staff at the desk were friendly and tried hard to please. The location is excellent and there are many local restaurants and a lively night-life scene. We paid $149 per night, and I considered that to be a bargain price for such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Junkie4Mileage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at Hotel Indigo for a quick stopover in Chicago. What a fantastic hotel! The location is great - it's close to the Red Line (5 minute walk) so it's very possible to take the El from either airport. If you're looking to explore the area around the hotel, walking in one direction from the hotel entrance puts you in the middle of the city - walk the other direction and you are in a great neighborhood (think: diverse architecture, people walking dogs, the whole bit...). The lobby was nice - a lot of people were having cocktails in the bar area. The rooms are pretty small, but well decorated and bright (makes it feel a bit larger). We didn't eat at the hotel (except coffee in the AM), but had a great breakfast at the 3rd Coast Cafe and Wine Bar, a 30 second walk from the hotel (try the stuffed french toast). We will definitely stay at the Indigo the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo or bust!”
Reviews.Author: DetroitTravelChick
Reviews.Content: As a young female traveler, I loved Hotel Indigo. I felt like I was walking into a spa when I first walked in....it looks awesome, almost like a quaint Florida/Carribean hotel and smells great too. The rooms were pretty big and I loved the decorations and hardwood floors. I also used the fitness room when I was there and that was great as well. The hotel is close to Rush Street, where there are tons of bars and restaurants. It is also close to the Clark/Division red line stop so you're minutes away from everything. I also loved the fact that there's a Walgreens a couple steps from the hotel, so you could buy things you forgot to pack at a reasonable price. I loved the location because you're a little removed from Michigan Avenue and have a more neighborhood feel. My favorite part of visiting Chicago is checking out all the indendent and unique stores and restaurants, not necessarily the ones on Michigan Avenue, so I am a little biased : ) But I showed a couple of my "Chicagoan" friends my hotel room and they could not stop ooohing and aaahing over it. I'm a Priority Club member so I frequent Holiday Inn hotels, and I must say this one is my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel Indigo”
Reviews.Author: chocco
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Indigo and it was WONDERFUL! Although we arrived early before check-in, the staff graciously stowed our bags and within minutes, our room was ready. We stayed on the 14th floor where it was quiet and serene. The room was decorated adorably with beautiful hardwood floors and retro style and colors (bright white painted wood with lavender, navy, and apple greens) all very clean and welcoming. In the mornings, the Starbucks within the hotel provided a nice selection of coffee, juice, bagels, and muffins. They even had a complete breakfast offered. The hotel is in a fabulous location within easy walking distance to shopping and sights of Chicago. Hotel Indigo is a small, boutique property perfect for those who are tired of the impersonal, stuffiness of the mega hotels with giant lobbies and mazes of floors. From now on we will always stay here when we are in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for a stay in Chicago!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pivo2000
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in a nice location in Chicago. Nice bars and restaurants in walking distance. 10 walking minutes to water tower place. Rooms are small but very nice and new furnished with cool colours. Would definetly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Book this one early”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Indigo as a result of its ranking on this Web site. Now, my wife would rather change the dates of our Chicago visits -- we have a son who lives in Chicago -- than change hotels. Most importantly, everyone associated with this hotel was nice, helpful and courteous. In today's world, that is an exception, not the rule.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Indigo Chicago Downtown Gold Coast
HotelInfo.Address: 1244 N Dearborn Pkwy, Chicago, IL 60610 (Formerly Claridge Hotel)
